Por lo general expende sus productos por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja, y su punto de venta lo realiza en su propio barrio, de lunes a domingo, a partir de las 5:30 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche.  Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su tienda con la finalidad de que pueda vender al por mayor, para que de esa manera incremente sus ingresos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está satisfecho con banco comunal, ya que todos son responsables en sus respectivos pagos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad con la finalidad de que pueda abastecer su tienda y de esa manera pueda atender a sus clientes sin complicación alguna.
texts.en:
Edith, who is 26 years old, lives with her partner and two children, Renzo, 8, and Madeleine, 2. They live together in their own house in the beautiful Ayacucho woods, in Santa Rosa. Edith is hardworking and enterprising. At an early age, she started working in her relatives' plantation, cultivating cocoa and coffee, but she wanted to expand her horizons. Now she has her own business, a shop, and she has many clients who frequent her establishment, thanks to her hospitality and the good prices she offers. She mainly buys her products herself, but sometimes her partner helps her, and she sells to people in her own neighborhood, every day of the week, from 5.30 in the morning to 9 at night. Her plan for the future is to expand her shop so that she can sell more and thus raise her income level. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she promises to meet her payment schedule. She is happy with the community bank, since everyone is responsible about making their respective payments. With the money she is requesting, she wants to invest in buying stock for her shop so she can take care of her clients without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

loans.name: Akatongore Savings & Credit, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
With the traits of hard work and high self-esteem, 32-year-old Prossy A. has tried beyond limits to maintain her general merchandise retail shop. She has been operating it for over 8 years from the Akatongore trading center in Ibanda in addition to her farming enterprises and owning rentals. Being one of the most attractive businesses here in Uganda, many business entrepreneurs have tried to invest in it as it normally cuts across all domestic appliances and general merchandise; Prossy is among the lucky ones benefiting from it. 

With this loan, she hopes to be able to purchase more stock as her drawback has been having little capital input. She also hopes to be in position to transform the business into a wholesale one in the future and improve her income. This will make Prossy meet her goals of educating her children and increasing the family income. 

She belongs to a group with other members who insure and hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing more stock for the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his daughter's university courses.

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es: Balvina vive en una aldea de San Martín Jilotepeque tiene 50 años de edad casada y tiene 7 hijos a su cargo. Balvina trabaja en su propia casa se dedica a la crianza de animales y también se dedica a hacer güipiles típicos para venderlos. Solicita el credito ara la compra de abono organico para cafetales, compra de cerdos, queire comprar un motor de agua para sacar el agua del pozo y regar su cultivo, dentro de sus planes se encuentra la siembra de milpa, plantas de cafe. Su sueño es que su negocio poco a poco prospere mas y mas.
texts.en:
Balvina lives in a village of San Martin Jilotepeque. She is 50 years old, married and has 7 children in her care. Balvina works in her own home raising animals and making traditional blouses to sell. She is seeking the loan to buy organic fertilizers for coffee plantations and to buy pigs. She wants to buy a water motor to draw water from the well to irrigate her crop. Her plans also include sowing crops (coffee plants). Her dream is that little by little her business grows more and more.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in fertilizers and pigs

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es: Emerson, de 20 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijo alguno. Reside en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su propia casa a base de adobe. Desde muy ayudaba a sus padres en la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao y café, pero Emerson decidió cambiar por nuevos rumbos, con la finalidad de que pueda retribuir con su familia, por las lecciones de la vida que lo inculcaron. Hoy trabaja en una construcción como albañil y se siente contento con el trabajo que realiza, desde luego que piensa seguir con sus estudios e especializarse en la carrera de ingeniería civil, pero por el  momento continuará con su trabajo. Su plan es terminar sus estudios y estudiar ingeniería civil, con el propósito de que pueda tener mayores oportunidades. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar durante las fechas pactadas, además asegura que existe un buen clima cordial en su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de muebles para acondicionar su casa, y de esa manera mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
20-year-old Emerson is single and has no children. He lives in the locality of Santa Rosa, located in the beautiful Ayacuchana jungle, where he has his own adobe house. Since he was very young he helped his parents with the agricultural activities, specifically the cocoa and coffee crops. However, Emerson decided to take a new path, with the aim of being able to reward his family for the life lessons that they instilled in him. Today he works as a builder in construction, and is happy with the work he does. Of course, he is thinking of continuing his studies and specializing in civil engineering, but at the moment he will continue with his job. His plan is to finish his studies and study civil engineering, with the goal of having better opportunities. This is his second loan with MFP, which he commits to pay back within the agreed dates. Moreover, he ensures that there is a cordial atmosphere in his communal bank. With the loan that he is seeking, he plans to invest in furniture to set up his house, and in this way improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture for his house

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Las Orquídeas. Esta ubicado en la comunidad de Jaloxtoc, municipio de Ayala, en el Estado de Morelos, México, el grupo esta conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen por ser vecinos. Este es su 2º préstamo con Fundación Realidad. 
La integrante del grupo la señora Dolores B. V., tiene 31 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria obteniendo su certificado de secundaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 hombres y 1 mujer, Lizbeth tiene 11 años y esta estudiando la primaria, Adrián tiene 6 años y va a iniciar a estudiar la primaria, José tiene 1 año. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo y necesita su préstamo para comprar perfumes de dama, caballero, rimel para las pestañas, lápiz labial, maquillajes, esmaltes para uñas. Inicio su negocio hace 5 años, que fue cuando una señora la invito a vender los productos de Jafra, la señora le da crédito mete su pedido y cuando llega su pedido le dan 28 días para pagar su producto. Ella sale a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa, su hija le ayuda en el negocio va a ofrecer los productos con las vecinas. Su negocio es importante por que se va ayudando económicamente para los gastos de su casa, también le gusta porque sale y se distrae un rato,  puede utilizar algún producto para que lo use ella y sus hijos, su negocio enfrenta la competencia de los productos de otras marcas ya que hay más personas vendiendo los mismos productos. La señora Dolores quiere comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus productos, remodelar su vivienda ponerle techo de colado. Sus esperanza son que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que lleguen a ser personas de bien, trabajadoras y honradas y esta muy contenta con el préstamo que recibirá porque se va a surtir de mercancía para ofrecerles a su clientela. 
Jaloxtoc es un lugar muy bonito se ve el campo verde.
Los integrantes del grupo son Dolores B. V. y va a comprar con su préstamo perfumes para dama, caballero, niño y niñas, labiales y desodorantes para surtir su negocio, la señora Maria Guadalupe F. C. va a comprar pollo muerto para venderlo por kilo y surtir su negocio, la señora Rosalinda T. T. va a comprar pantalones, blusas, faldas, vestidos, playeras para niño y niña para surtir su negocio, la señora Maricela L. Hernández  va a comprar verdura, jitomates, papa, cebolla, frutas, sandia, manzana, plátano, mango etc. Para surtir su puesto de frutas y legumbres, la señota Eva Barragán A. va a comprar colchas y sabanas para iniciar su negocio.  
Los integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Función Realidad “Gracias por el apoyo que nos proporcionan"
texts.en:
This supportive group is called Las Orquídeas (The Orchids). It is located in the Jaloxtoc community in the municipality of Ayala in Morelos state, Mexico. The group has 5 members who know each other because they are neighbors. This is their second loan from Fundacíon Realidad. The group member Dolores is 31 years old and studied through the third year of secondary school and graduated with her certificate of secondary education. She has 3 children, 2 boys and 1 girl. Lisbeth is 11 years old and is at primary school, Adrián is 6 years old and is going to start primary school, and José is one year old. She works selling products from a catalog and needs this loan to buy women's and men's scents, mascara, lipstick, makeup, and nail polish. She began her business 5 years ago when a woman invited her to sell products from the company Jafra. You can buy your order on credit, and when your order arrives, you have 28 days to pay for your products. Dolores goes door to door selling her products, her daughter helps her sell products to their neighbors. Her business is important because it helps pay the household expenses, and she also likes to go out and get distracted by her work for a while. She and her children can use the products. Her business faces competition from other brands and there are other people selling the same products. Dolores wants to buy a glass case to display her products and remodel her house by putting on a new roof. Her hope is that her children will continue studying so that the will be good people, hardworking and honest. She is very happy about the loan because she will receive supplies that she can offer to her clients. Jaloxtoc is a very beautiful place where you can see the green countryside. The group members are Dolores, who is going to buy perfumes for women, men, boys, and girls; lipsticks; and deodorants to stock her business; Maria, who is going to buy chicken meat to sell buy the kilo and stock her store; Rosalinda, who is going to buy trousers, blouses, skirts, dresses, and children's t-shirts to stock her store; Maricela, who is going to buy vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, onion, fruits, watermelon, apples, bananas, mango, etc, to supply her fruit and vegetables stall; and Eva, who is going to buy quilts and sheets to start her business. The group members want to tell Kiva and Fundacíon "thank you for the support that you provide to us."

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products like perfumes for men and women, mascara, lipstick, makeup, and nail polish.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: El Sr. L. S. Rodrigo de 44 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus pequeños hijos. Tiene casa propia, la cual se encuentra ubicada en Lujaraja perteneciente al del distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como auxiliar de campo en una empresa agrícola. Su esposa es obrera eventual, pero mayormente trabaja en su negocio de internet que tienen en su domicilio. El Sr. Rodrigo es una persona muy emprendedora que gracias a su empeño a logrado construir parte de su vivienda. Requiere el crédito para poder terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño, según nos comenta es terminar de construir dicha vivienda, para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr. Rodrigo esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
44-year-old L. S. Rodrigo lives with his wife and small children. He owns his own home, which is located in Lujaraja in the district of Santiago. He works as a field assistant in an agriculture company. His wife is a temporary laborer, but principally works in her internet business that she has at home. Mr. Rodrigo is an enterprising person that, thanks to his effort, has managed to construct part of their home. He needs the loan to finish building their home. His dream, as he tells it, is to finish constructing this home in order to have a better quality of life. Mr. Rodrigo is very thankful for the support that we can offer him through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Yecenia Del Carmen

texts.es: Yecenia S. tiene 3 hijos es madre soltera, se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, desinfectantes, jabones, ella nos cuenta que ahora ella misma fabrica el producto que vende y asi obtiene mas ganacias, ademas vende perfumes en San Raymundo, tiene ya años su pequeño negocio, ahora quiere tener un poco mas de material para la fabricación es por eso que quiere este nuevo crédito para poder ampliarlo, hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien por eso espera que FAPE / KIVA le siga dando la oportunidad de superacion y asi sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Yecenia S. is a single mother of three. She sells cleaning products, disinfectants and soaps. She tells us that she makes the products that she sells herself, which allows her to make bigger profits. In addition, she sells perfumes in San Raymundo. Her business is already several years old. Now she wants to have a little more material to make her products, which is why she is seeking this new loan to expand her business. To date, it has been going really well, and thus she hopes that FAPE/KIVA continue giving her opportunities for advancement and in this way help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano, de 36 años de edad, está casado y tiene cinco hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su propia casa. Feliciano se caracteriza por ser un hombre emprendedor, vende cacao, a precio incomparable, debido a la calidad y cantidad que ofrece a sus compradores más recurrentes, sin embargo hay alguno lugares en el que no puede abastecer de este productos a sus clientes, por otro lado sus ventas aumentaron considerablemente y eso lo resulta buenas ganancias económicas. Por lo general trabaja con su esposa y juntos hacen un buen equipo y en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita la ayuda de sus peones para que puedan facilitar la extracción del producto final, normalmente su producto de cacao los vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su producción agrícola, adquiriendo nuevos terrenos de cultivo, con la finalidad de que pueda cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pago, además hace hincapié a su grupo comunal, por el buen clima cordial que existe. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en darle mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao, con el propósito de mejorar la calidad  y cantidad de su producto agrícola.
texts.en:
Feliciano is 36 years old, married, and has 5 children in school. They live together in the community of Santa Rosa, located in the beautiful Auacuchana jungle where they have their own home. Feliciano can be characterized as an enterprising man. He sells cocoa at an excellent price, thanks to the quality and quantity that he offers to his most regular buyers. However, there are some times when he can't supply products to his customers, but, on the other hand, his sales are increasing considerably and this results in good income. In general, he works with his wife and they make a good team. Sometimes their children also help. During the harvest time, though, they need help of hired workers to facilitate the extraction of the final product. They normally sell their cocoa in the collection centers in their community. His plan for the future is to increase his agricultural production, acquiring new farmland, with the goal of being able to meet the demand of his clients. This is the second loan he has had with MFP, and he promises to continue meeting his repayment obligations. He also emphasizes his community group that has a very cordial atmosphere. He will use the loan to maintain his cocoa plantations in order to improve the quality and quantity of his agricultural product.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his cocoa plantations

loans.name: Indepedientes Group

texts.es:
La señora Aurora E. P., tiene sesenta  años de edad, vive en la Ribera Llano Grande Municipio de coapilla, Estado de Chiapas México. Tuvo la oportunidad de casarse muy joven en donde  desafortunadamente no tuvo hijos, su esposo falleció hace diez años quedándose sola sin nadie de quien recibir apoyo.

 Se dedica a su hogar y a  la tienda de abarrotes que está ubicado en su mismo domicilio en donde vende azúcar, frijol, arroz, aceite entre otros insumos más. Comenzó con esta actividad hace siete años y gracias a Dios le va bien en este pequeño trabajo ya que hay personas que le compran regular de producto,  por ser una tienda que está en buena ubicación y   brinda buena atención a su clientela.

 Lo razón de practicar esta actividad fue la necesidad, ya que se quedo sola y no tiene de quien de pender, sus vecinas la animaron a que pusiera un negocio para de ahí obtener ingresos en su hogar y haiga la necesidad de salir a otro lugar para trabajar.

 Con las ganancias que obtiene de su tienda de abarrotes compra más mercancía para tener lo necesario y sus clientes compren lo que buscan, a si también  ahorrar para construir un local en donde pueda vender más productos pues comenta que su casa es muy pequeña y necesita espacio para atender mejor a sus clientes.

 Aurora paso a forma parte del grupo ya que la invitaron las dos integrantes mas del programa, el grupo se llama independientes la razón del nombre es porque cada una de ellas trabaja para no depender solo de sus esposos.
  Las personas que integran el grupo son tres señoras con actividades diferentes:
  Iddai  S. Guzmán: invierte el préstamo en compra de cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlo en la misma región.
  Margoth C. P.: se dedica a la venta de compra y venta de pollos para venderlo aliñados.
  Aurora E. P.: es la señora que se le  tomo le entrevista y esta de vestido color azul se dedica a  su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Sra. Aurora E. P. is 60 years old and lives the town of Coapilla in Ribera Llano Grande, State of Chiapas, México. She took the opportunity to get married at a young age, but unfortunately she does not have any children. Her husband passed away ten years ago, leaving her alone with nobody to support her.

Aurora stays at home where she manages a grocery store, selling sugar, beans, rice, oil, and other supplies. She started this business and, thanks to God, has done well from doing a little bit of work. Aurora has several customers who buy her products regularly since her store is in a good location and she provides good service.

She started this business out of necessity since she lives alone and is not able to depend on anyone. Her neighbors encouraged to pursue this business so that she could generate a household income and have a means of working so that she can stay ahead.

With the earnings generated by her grocery store, she is able to buy more merchandise that she is lacking and her customers are looking to buy. She is also saving some money so that she can construct a building where she can sell more products. Aurora says her house is very small, so she needs more space in order to provide better service to her customers.

Aurora started this group by inviting two other members into the program. The group is called “Independientes” (Independent) because each of these women work without having to depend on their husbands. The members of this group consist of three women involved in different business activities:

• Iddai S. Guzmán will use her loan to buy pigs for fattening and resale in the local area. • Margoth C. P. buys chickens and sells them dressed. • Aurora E. P. manages a store and is the woman who was interviewed. In the photograph, she is wearing a blue dress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, beans, oil, eggs, pasta, and other products

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es: Honorata, de 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tiene su propia casa. A Honorata siempre le ha gustado la idea de ser jefa de su propio negocio, desde luego que lo consiguió, pero recuerda que no todo fue fácil en un inicio. Actualmente vende cacao de manera considerable, desde luego que está muy contenta con la labor que viene realizando, además cuenta con más clientes que antes. Por lo general trabaja sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo, pero en tiempos de cultivo y cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones con la finalidad de que lo puedan agilizar en un tiempo corto. Su punto de venta lo realiza normalmente en los centros de acopio de su localidad y sus planes a futuro es comprar nuevos terrenos de cultivo con el propósito de aumentar su productividad y de esa forma mejore la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además asevera que le brinda muchas ventajas al pertenecer a su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos para que lo dé un mantenimiento exhaustivo a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Honorata is 44 years old, married, and has six children. They live together in their own home in the town of Santa Rosa, which is located in the beautiful tropical jungles of Peru. Honorata has always liked the idea of being the boss of her own business. However, everything was not easy at the beginning. She currently sells a significant amount of cacao and is very happy with the work that is being done. Honorata has many more customers than she did before. She usually works alone, but occasionally she will receive help from her husband. During the planting and harvesting seasons, she hires laborers so that all the work gets finished in a short amount of time. She normally sells her crops at the local collection centers. Her future plans include buying additional farmland so that she can increase her productivity and improve the quality of life for her family.

This is her seventh loan with MFP. Honorata promises to continue submitting her payments on time. She says she receives many benefits as a result of being a member of her Communal Bank. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase supplies and compost so that her cacao crops receive ongoing maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies & compost

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair cosmetics

loans.name: Sara Mariana

texts.es:
Sara de 66 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución), , ella vende productos de uso personal como cosméticos por catalogo de marca Yambal /empresa que ayuda a mujeres emprendedoras. 

Ella inicio con las ventas de cosméticos Yambal para tener ingresos y poder ayudar con los gastos familiares. Vende maquillaje, perfumes, cremas, desodorantes a un bajo costo por catalogo. 

Ella quiere construir mejor su casa con el préstamo quiere comprar bloques, cemento, piedras. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local y poder comprar un carro ya que por su edad no puede movilizarse a repartir los pedidos.
texts.en:
Sara is 66 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran (a periurban area with a deteriorating ecosystem). She sells personal care products, such as cosmetics, through a catalog. These products are manufactured by Yanbal, a company that helps women entrepreneurs.

Sara started selling Yanbal cosmetics in order to have income to help with the family expenses. She sells make-up, perfumes, crèmes, and deodorants at low cost by catalog.

Sara wants to build a better house, so she will use this loan to buy blocks, cement, and stone. In the future, she wants to have her own store and be able to buy a car. At her age, she is not able to get around easily to deliver her orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, blocks, and stone

loans.name: El Sueño Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama El Sueño. Esta ubicado en Tlayecac, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México. El grupo esta conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen por ser vecinos. Este es su 1er. Préstamo con Fundacion Realidad.
La integrante del grupo la señora Araceli E. C. tiene 33 años de edad, estudio hasta la secundaria obtuvo su certificado. Ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos varones Eduardo tiene 8 años de edad y esta estudiando la primaria, Alexander tiene 2 años. La señora Araceli va a iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa y necesita su préstamo para comprar blusas, pantalones, camisas, faldas, etc. para surtirse de mercancía, va a trasladarse la ciudad de Cuernavaca a surtirse de su mercancía. Ella quiere repillar su casa y ponerle la puerta por que ya se cambiaron a vivir a su casa pero no esta terminada, y decidió iniciar con el negocio para ayudar en los gastos y terminar de  repillar y poner la puerta de su casa para que se  vea bonita y este mas segura con sus niños. Sus sueños son trabajar para crecer en el negocio de la venta de ropa para obtener ganancias e invertirlas en su casa. El negocio esta en su casa en Tlayecac y enfrenta la competencia de varias personas que venden los mismos productos. Ella esta muy emocionado pon el préstamo que le proporcionan porque va a poder superarse, trabajar para crecer en su negocio y espera que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que terminen sus estudios.
Las integrantes del grupo son la señora Araceli E. C. y va a comprar blusas, pantalones, camisas, faldas, etc. para hincar su negocio, la señora Lulu Rodríguez Gutiérrez va a comprar blusas, faldas, pantalones para dama para surtir su negocio, la señora Mitzi Yuridia B. Rodríguez va a comprar perfumes y  cosméticos por mayoreo para vender, la señora virginia C. B. va a comprar Huaraches de dama para surtir su negocio, la señora Yeimi García V. va a Comprar donas y diademas para el cabello, pulseras y collares para surtir su negocio.
Las integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad: “Gracias por apoyarnos con el préstamo, con ese dinero vamos a salir adelante nuestros negocios y nuestras familias”
texts.en:
This solidarity group called “El Sueño” (The Dream) is from Tlayecac, Ayala, in the State of Morelos in México. The group consists of five members who know one another since they are neighbors. This is their first loan with Fundación Realidad.

One of the group members is Sra. Araceli E. C.. She is 33 years old and was able to achieve her high school diploma. Araceli is married and has two sons: Eduardo who is 8 years old and attending elementary school, and Alexander who is 2 years old. She plans to start a business selling clothing, so she needs a loan to buy blouses, trousers, shirts, skirts, and other items so that she can be stocked with merchandise. Araceli will travel to the city of Cuernavaca to obtain her inventory. She wants to whitewash her house and install a door since her family just moved into their house, but the work is still not finished. The reason for starting this business is to help with the expenses and to complete the work on her house so that it will be beautiful and be more secure for her children. Her dreams include growing her clothing business, earning more income, and investing in her home. She operates her business out of her house in Tlayecac and has competition from different merchants who sell the same products. Araceli is excited about her loan because it will provide her the opportunity to get ahead and grow her business. In addition, she hopes that her children will continue with their studies and complete their education.

The members of the group are as follows: • Araceli E. C. is starting her business and will sell blouses, trousers, shirts, skirts, and other items. • Sra. Lulu Rodríguez Gutiérrez will restock her business with blouses, skirts, and women’s trousers to sell. • Sra. Mitzi Yuridia B. Rodríguez will buy perfumes and cosmetics from a wholesaler to sell. • Sra. Virginia C. B. will buy women’s sandals to restock her business. • Sra. Yeimi García V. will buy hairclips, tiaras, bracelets, and necklaces to restock her business.

The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “Thank you for supporting us with this loan. The money will help us move forward in our businesses and with our families.”

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blouses, trousers, shirts, skirts, and other items

loans.name: Katiuska

texts.es: Katiuska, de 32 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen tres hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tiene su propio techo a base de madera. A pesar de tener primaria incompleta, Katiuska no se amilanó ante las adversidades que se les presentaba en el camino, es mas sacó a relucir las fuerzas necesarias, con el objetivo de que pueda crear su propio negocio, específicamente en la actividad agrícola. Hoy  produce y comercializa cacao de manera considerable hacia sus compradores más potenciales, desde luego que está percibiendo buenos ingresos económicos, debido a la oportuna entrega que realiza con cada uno de sus clientes. Normalmente trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja, pero en temporada de cosecha y cultivo tiene a cargo de sus peones, para que de esa manera lo puedan facilitar en la extracción de su producto de cacao y luego venderlos en los centros de acopio de su localidad. Su plan a futuro es expandirse en otras zonas, para ello buscará nuevos terrenos de cultivo en otras zonas estratégicas con la finalidad de que pueda minimizar costo y tiempo. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos. Además está contenta con su banco comunal, ya que le resulta muy beneficioso. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Katiuska is 32 years old. She lives with her spouse and they have three schoolage children together. They live together in the community of Santa Rosa, where they have their own house made of wood. Despite not having finished primary school, Katiuska was undaunted by the adversity in her path. She summoned the necessary strength to start her own business, specifically in agriculture. Today she produces and sells considerable amounts of cacao to her biggest customers. This brings her good income, due to the timely delivery to each of her customers. Normally, she works with her spouse, but at harvest and planting time she hires farmhands so that it is easier to extract the cacao product and then sell it in the stockpiling centers of her community. Her plan for the future is to expand to other areas. For this she will look for new cropland in strategic areas with the purpose of minimizing time and cost. This is her first loan with MFP. She is committed to making the payments according to schedule. She is also happy with her communal bank, since it has been very beneficial. With the loan that she is asking for, she plans oninvesting in giving her cacao plantings suitable maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain her cacao plantings

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu is married to a photographer and has three dependants, including two of her daughters who are in primary school. Kadiatu is an experienced businesswoman in textiles. She has been doing textiles for the past seven years. Kadiatu sells in Shenge market, which happens to be the biggest market in Bo city. Kadiatu has a very good loan repayment history. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to help her buy different types of textiles, as this season is her peak season for sales. Kadiatu intends to use the proceeds from this loan to help her husband educate their children and buy land where they want to build their family house.

loans.use: To buy more textiles

loans.name: Lehnerr

texts.es: Lehnerr, de 28 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijo alguno. Vive en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana,  donde tiene su propia casa. Apenas tiene secundaria completa, pero eso no lo impidió a que siguiera con sus sueños que tanto había anhelado, desde luego que concretó su objetivo de tener su propia carpintería en donde realiza todo tipo de muebles, según a los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes, en consecuencia sus ganancias van en aumento. Normalmente trabaja con sus operarios, para que de esa manera puedan minimizar tiempo y costo en la elaboración de los muebles. Usualmente su negocio de ebanistería se encuentra ubicado en su propio inmueble de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche, de lo cual se siente contento con lo que viene realizando, ya que con la ventas que realiza piensa ampliar su carpintería, con el propósito de introducir en maquinas para facilitar su trabajo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está conforme con su banco comunal, debido a que son responsables con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de madera, de todo tipo de calidad, con la finalidad de otorgarle productos en un tiempo record y cumpla con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lehnerr is 28 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives in the community of Santa Rosa, located in the beautiful jungle of Ayacucho. He owns his own home. He barely finished high school, but this did not stop him from following his dreams. He attained his goal of having his own carpentry shop where he makes all types of furniture, according to the tastes and preferences of his customers. As a result, his incomes is climbing. Normally he works with employees; in this way he minimizes the time and cost of making the furniture. His woodshop is located in his own house and is open Monday through Saturday from 7:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night. He is happy with what he is doing, and with his sales he is planning on expanding his carpenter shop so he can bring in machinery to facilitate the work. This is his fifth loan with MFP and he is committed to making the payments on time. He is also happy with his community bank, because they are responisble with their payments. He plans on investing the loan that he is asking for in purchasing wood of all different qualities so that he can finish his products in record time and meet the demands of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood to be able to make more furniture.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
el grupo Genesis esta ubicado en el barrio La Redonda El Aguila Jamastran. son personas que tienen varios años de conocerse,  a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la sra. Santos Cristina L. R. se dedica al comercio, Santos cuenta con una pulpería, bici partes y molino.
Cuenta con mas de 8 años en el manejo de este tipo de actividad, y gracias al apoyo financiero que se le ha brindado, Santos ha aprovechado al máximo, ya que su negocio ha crecido significativamente siendo uno de los mas surtidos en la zona.

el sr. Santos Julian L. R. se dedica al comercio y la industria ya que se dedica a lo que es la venta de granos básicos y la elaboración y venta de muebles de madera, actividad que tiene mas de 7 años de venir realizando ininterrumpidamente, en esta aldea no se contaba con Energía Eléctrica y tenia que realizar su trabajos de artesanales de manera rustica costándole mucho mas tiempo darles un mejor acabado. Ahora con la instalación de energía eléctrica Santos Julián piensa en comprar maquinaria eléctrica para hacer mas facil el trabajo de carpinteria.

la sra. Nohemi del Carmen R. se dedica al comercio, Nohemi cuenta con una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos de consumo popular desde hace mas de 4 años en su sector son pocos los negocios que existen lo que le permite tener clientela permanente, su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco gracias a la buena administración.

la sra. Karen Yesenia O. se dedica al comercio. vende ropa americana clasificada y nueva, calzado y cosméticos desde hace mas de 3 años siendo la gente de su aldeas y lugares aledaños sus clientes los que visita 4 días a la semana lo que le permite cuidar de su pequeña hija    
Nos esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de mercadería y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, presento algunos gastos médicos ya que se le enfermo su niña razón por la cual se descapitalizo.
texts.en:
The group, Genesis, is located in the La Redonda El Aguila Jamastran neighborhood. The members have known each other for many years. The following is a description of the different occupations that they work in: Señorita Santos Cristina L. R. works in sales. Santos owns a general store, a bicycle parts shop, and a mill. She has been in this business for over 8 years and thanks to the financial support that has been offered to her, Santos has taken full advantage of it and has watched her business grow significantly, since it is one of the best stocked shops in the area. Señor Santos Julian L. R. also works in sales and industrials. He works in the sale of basic grains and the elaboration and sale of wood furniture, a sector that he has worked in for over 7 uninterrupted years. In the village, there wasn't electricity and he had to do all of his work manually, which was very time consuming. Now, with electrical installation, Santos Julián wants to purchase electric machinery in order to make his carpentry work easier. Señorita Nohemi del Carmen R. works in sales. Nohemi owns a small general store where she sells popular consumption products for over 4 years. There aren't many similar businesses in her area which allows her to have a permanent and steady flow of regular customers. Her business has been growing little by little thanks to good administration. Señorita Karen Yesenia O. works in sales as well. She has been selling new American clothes, shoes, and cosmetics for over 3 years. Her clients are from her village and surrounding ones. They frequent her business 4 days a week, allowing her to care for her young daughter, Nos. She is seeking a credit to be able to purchase merchandise and as such satisfy her clients' demands. Due to recent medical costs caused by her daughter becoming sick, her earnings decreased.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans, rice, sugar, bread, lard, oil, pasta, sauces, refreshments, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés, de 39 años de edad, es soltero y tiene dos hijos en etapa escolar. Cuenta con un techo propio y está ubicada en una localidad de la selva central llamada “Santa Rosa”. Moisés se caracteriza por ser un hombre seguro de sí mismo, se dedica en la producción y comercialización de cacao, fruto que tiene mucha demanda en su localidad, además el buen servicio que brinda le ha hecho ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes. Actualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en temporada de cultivo y cosecha necesita de sus peones para que de esa manera agilicen con la extracción de producto final y de ese modo pueda vender en los centros de acopio de su localidad y a un precio razonable. Sus planes a futuro es adquirir nuevos terrenos para el cultivo, con la finalidad de aumentar su productividad y a la vez mejorar sus ingresos considerablemente. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pago, además está conforme por el buen andamiaje de su banco comunal.
Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de cacao de otros productores, con la finalidad de lograr vender en cantidad y por ende aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Moisés, 39 years old, is single and has got 2 school-aged children. He has got his own home, which is located in the region of the central jungle called "Santa Rosa." Moisés is characterized for being a self-assured man. He works in the production and commercialization of cacao, a highly demanded fruit in his region. In addition, his clients prefer his business because of the good customer service that he provides. Currently, he works for himself but during cultivation and harvest season, he needs his laborers in order to speed up the final production so that he can sell it to the distribution centers in his area and at a reasonable price. His future plans are to acquire new cultivation terrains, with the finality of increasing his productivity and at the same time improving his earnings considerably. This is his fifth credit with MFP, and he promises to continue to fulfill his payment obligations. In addition, he agrees with the framework of his communal bank. With the credit that he is seeking, he plans to invest it in the purchase of other cacao products, with the end result of selling it in bulk and thus increasing his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase other cacao products in order to increase his earnings.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda, de 36 años de edad, convive con su pareja, y tiene dos hijos en su haber. Ella vive en la localidad de Santa Rosa (ceja de selva), donde tiene su casa propia. Recuerda que en aquellos años anteriores su pareja no tenia trabajo alguno, solo tenían una pequeña parcela de cultivo de cacao, pero que en ciertas ocasiones solo lo servían para que cubra su canasta familiar, pero gracias al apoyo incondicional de sus padres, supieron sobresalir de esa etapa difícil. Hoy cultivan y comercializan en grandes cantidades a sus compradores más potenciales, de lo cual se sienten satisfechos con el producto que los brinda, desde luego que recibe buenas ganancias económicas por las ventas que realiza. Por lo general tiene ayuda de su pareja permanentemente y juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus peones para que así lo faciliten en la extracción de producto final. Normalmente los vende en los centros de acopio de su propia localidad a un precio competitivo y sus planes a futuro es adquirir nuevas tierras, con el propósito de que pueda mejorar su calida de vida y la de su familia. Este es su decimocuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además esta contento con su banco comunal, ya que le otorga buenos resultados económicos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos con la finalidad de darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Nilda, 36 years old, lives with her spouse and has got two children. She lives in the locality of Santa Rosa (on the edge of the jungle), where she has her own home. She recalls that a few years back, her spouse didn't have a job and they only had a small crop of cacao plants that in certain occasions could barely provide for her family. Thanks to the unconditional support of her parents, they were able to overcome that difficult time. Nowadays they cultivate and sell in large quantities to their buyers, who feel satisfied with the product that they are purchasing. As a result, the sales produce good earnings. In general, she receives constant help from her spouse and together they make a good team. Sometimes she receives help from laborers to help facilitate the final production. Normally she sells her product to the distribution centers in her area at a competitive price. Her future plans are to acquire new land with the proposal of improving her quality of life and that of her family's. This is her fourteenth credit with MFP. As such, she promises to continue fulfilling her payment plan. In addition, she is happy with her communal bank for providing good economic results. With the credit that she is seeking, she plans to invest in the purchase of supplies and fertilizers in order to properly maintain her cacao plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer to be used on her cacao plantations.

loans.name: Señor De Muruhuay Group

texts.es:
SEÑOR D. MURUHUAY
La señora Mahalda B. y su esposo vendían  esponjas y medicinas para los hongos, D. eso ya quince años, desD. hace un año y medio que trabaja con EDAPROSPO incorporándose a este grupo D. vecinas que ya llevan 3 años trabajando con su ayuda, su negocio es D. venta D. Productos Naturales, en el futuro desea tener un puesto en el mercado, los ingresos le sirve para sustentar su hogar y también los estudios D. sus cuatro hijos que aun dependen D. ella, gracias a su esfuerzo ya ah logrado construir su casa.
texts.en:
SEÑOR D. MURUHUAY GROUP Mahalda B. and her husband have been selling sponges and medicines for fungal infections for fifteen years. For the last year and a half she has been working with EDAPROSPO, having joined a group of neighbors who three years ago started receiving support. Mahalda sells natural products. In future she would like to have a market stall. She uses the income to support her home and the the studies of his four children, who are still dependant on her. Thanks to her effort she has already managed to build her home.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products and raw materials.

loans.name: Marbelle

texts.es: Marbelle C. V., tiene la edad de 28 años, está casado, y  tiene un hijo de  10 años de edad, que es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Marbelle también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Marbelle C. V. is 28 years old. She is married and has a 10 year old son, who is her highest priority. She requests the loan to support her farm, for growing coffee in particular. Her plan is to buy manure and fertilizer. She wants to give her coffee crops the required maintenance to achieve a better quality and the highest income possible at harvest time. This is the first time she requests a loan through FUDECOSUR and is very happy with the support received. Marbelle has been working in agriculture for years. In future she hopes to be able to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to continue to grow both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Support for coffee growing.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Reina María S. Agüero, tiene la edad de 32 años, está soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres y hermanos. El crédito lo quiere para la reparación de un Trapiche. La idea es comprar materiales para la reconstrucción del galerón para el trapiche. Con esto  se espera poder contar con una estructura donde puedan realizar los trabajos de  sacar el dulce. Cuenta con un trapiche donde realizan el proceso de sacar el dulce. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Reina  tiene algunos años dedicada a este negocio. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Reina María S. Agüero is 32 years old and single, with no children. She lives with her parents and siblings. She is requesting this loan to repair a sugar cane mill. She plans to buy materials to rebuild the mill shed. Once done she hopes to own a structure where to carry out the tasks required to extract the raw sugar. She already owns a sugar cane crusher to extract the raw sugar. This is the first time she requests a loan through FUDECOSUR and is very happy with the support received. Reina has been in this line of business for a few years. In future she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to continue to grow both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair sugar cane mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer to plant 1 ½mnz of rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her salon

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo es viudo; vive con  sus hijos de 20,15,12,10 y 8 años en casa propia en la  zona de Pasankeri sur de esta ciudad de La Paz.

El señor Pablo trabaja  como albañil y a la vez da en alquiler dos habitaciones y un garaje de los cuales obtiene sus ingresos para el hogar.

El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de dos habitaciones y unas gradas mejorando así su calidad de vida.
Es su tercer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Pablo is a widower. He lives with his children, who are 20, 15, 12, 10, and 8 years old. They live in the Pasankeri South area of the city of La Paz. Pablo works as a bricklayer. He also rents out two rooms and a garage to get income for his household. The requested loan is to build two rooms and some steps to improve his quality of life. This is his third loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build two rooms and some steps to improve his quality of life

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es:
Don Jaime, habita en la comarca  Buena Vista de Nueva Guinea junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus hijos: el mayor que tiene 13 años y el menor de todos de 10 años de edad. Jaime labora en su finca realizando actividades pecuarias y agricolas  las cuales son sus principales fuentes de ingreso, trabaja en conjunto con su familia en estas actividades. 

Actualmente esta  necesitando financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de ternero de desarrollo y asi aumentar su inventario ganadero y en el transcurso de un año poder vender animales de peso que generen mayores ingresos mejorando la economia del hogar. 

En su comunidad lo consideran como un hombre progresivo, trabajador y responsable,  espera ser beneficiado con el credito para poder hacer realidad su sueño, y mejorar sus niveles economicos que le permita brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jaime lives in the Buena Vista de Nueva Guinea region. He lives with his family, which is comprised of his wife and children. The oldest child is 13 years old, and the youngest is ten years old. Jaime works with livestock and does agricultural work on a farm. These are his main sources of income. He works together with his family doing these activities. He currently needs a loan to buy a calf to raise. That way he will increase his livestock inventory. In a year’s time he will be able to sell the animal by weight. This will generate greater income and improve the household’s financial situation. In his community he is considered to be a progressive, hard-working, and responsible man. He hopes to be granted the loan to be able to make his dream come true. He wants to improve his finances, which will allow him to give his family better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a calf to raise

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es:
El señor Gualberto P. es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Las Lomas de esta ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Gualberto P.  que trabaja en la policía nacional de los cuales obtiene sus ingresos para el hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para el acabado en obra fina de una habitación  mejorando así su calidad de vida.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Gualberto P. is single and he lives with his parents in the Las Lomas district in the city of La Paz. He works with the national police force where he earns the income for the household. The requested loan is to complete improvements to their home, to improve their quality of life. The first loan and the socio-economic analysis carried out is favorable and qualifies him to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete improvements to their home

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El señor Victor R. es casado; vive con su esposa y sus hijas de 12, 5 y 2 años en alquiler en la zona de Villa fatima  de esta ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Victor R.  trabaja en una empresa  grafica como prensista y la esposa trabaja en una fábrica de costura, de los cuales obtienen sus ingresos para el hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para conseguir un departamento en anticretico (es una forma legal de vivir en un departamento o casa, por un tiempo determinado y por una cantidad acordada con el dueño del departamento; al cabo del tiempo, el dinero es devuelto en su totalidad por el dueño de casa) y así mejorar su calidad de vida y dejar de pagar el alquiler mensual.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor R. is married, he lives with is wife and their daughters, aged 12, 5, and 2. They rent their home located in the Villa Fatima district in the city of La Paz. He works in a graphics printing company as a printing technician and his wife works in a taylor's shop. They both contribute their earnings to the family finances. The loan requested is to lease an apartment (a specific legal way of living in an apartment or a house for a set period of time, for a fee negotiated with the owner of the apartment. With the lapse of a term the full sum of money is returned by the owner of the apartment. This will improve their quality of life and will no longer have to pay monthly rent. This is his first loan and the socio-economic analysis carried out is favorable and qualifies him to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lease an apartment.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora, de 18 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijo alguno. Vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, específicamente en la localidad de Santa Rosa. A Nora siempre le ha gustado ayudar a tíos desde su adolescencia en un restaurante que ellos poseen, y a cambio del trabajo recibe una remuneración considerable. Ella anhela en un corto plazo estudiar la carrera de agronomía, de esa manera pueda contribuir con su familia y la sociedad, desde luego que primero va prepararse. Es por ello que trata de esforzarse en su trabajo, por el cual se siente cómoda, ya que le dá la oportunidad de socializarse con varias personas. Su plan a futuro es ser una gran profesional en agronomía, con la finalidad de que pueda sostenerse de forma independiente. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP,  por el cual se asegura cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además se siente en confianza con su grupo comunal, ya que toman decisiones eficaces. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en lo estudios, para ello se preparará en una academia, especialmente para la carrera que va postular.
texts.en:
Nora is 18 years old, she is single and she does not have any children. She lives with her parents in a house located in the beautiful region of the Ayacucha forest, specifically, in the Santa Rosa village. Since she was a teenager Nora has always enjoyed helping her uncles run their restaurant, and for her work she is receives good wages. In the near future she aspires to study agriculture so that she may be able to help support her family and contribute to society. She works hard at her job, a job that grants her financial stability and an opportunity to meet different people. Her plan for the future is to become an expert agriculturer with the goal of one day becoming independent. This will be her second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to the obligations of this loan. She enjoys her group in the community bank, especially because they always make sound decisions. The loan that she requests will be invested in her studies. She wishes to begin her academic studies towards the career of which she dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition expenses to study a career in agriculture

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana G. is  49 years old and she has four children; three of whom are now adults, with seperate families. Susana married at a very young age and now she has been married for 33 years.
She works as a dressmaker for 20 years, this profession develops in various ways; either working for others, as in the early stage or developing your own business, as it did later.
After working for a long time as a clothing factory worker, Susan left her job to pursue this activity by selling clothes;  a totally independent activity. She has been doing it for two years.
She took advantage of her husband’s travels , international travels who is a driver. When he goes to Chile, he brings clothes, blankets which she sell at a cheaper price at home. She also delivers the murchandise to others who carry out the sale and this way too she collaborates to employ other people.
The credit obtained from the Paraguayan Foundation is invested in the purchase of a good range of clothes and winter coats. Susan thanked the institution that provides support to micro business.
texts.en:
Susana G. is 49 years old and she has four children; three of whom are now adults, with seperate families. Susana married at a very young age and now she has been married for 33 years. She works as a dressmaker for 20 years, this profession develops in various ways; either working for others, as in the early stage or developing your own business, as it did later. After working for a long time as a clothing factory worker, Susan left her job to pursue this activity by selling clothes; a totally independent activity. She has been doing it for two years. She took advantage of her husband’s travels , international travels who is a driver. When he goes to Chile, he brings clothes, blankets which she sell at a cheaper price at home. She also delivers the murchandise to others who carry out the sale and this way too she collaborates to employ other people. The credit obtained from the Paraguayan Foundation is invested in the purchase of a good range of clothes and winter coats. Susan thanked the institution that provides support to micro business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jackets, pants, shirts, sweaters and coats

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Señor B. R. Miguel Angel es un joven de 27 años que vive junto a sus padres en la zona conocida como Villa Candelaria, la cual queda en la zona Norte de la Ciudad de Cochabamba. Miguel es una persona joven que mientras estudia trabaja, y en el tiempo libre acude en las noches a clases de idiomas. Miguel es soltero y por lo pronto sigue estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas.

Miguel es Ejecutivo de Ventas de la Empresa BEICRUZ S.A. desde el 09 de abril del 2008 según certificado de trabajo presentado demostró en este tiempo eficiencia, eficacia y puntualidad en su trabajo. Por otro lado el cliente también se dedica a la Comercialización de repuestos electrónicos y otros relacionados. EL crédito que solicita es para poder comprar repuestos electrónicos para poder venderlos con cierto margen de ganancia.

Miguel nos cuenta que su primera meta es poder salir profesional y como segunda meta el poder abrir una tienda de repuestos electrónicos y de esa manera no trabajar para nadie y poder generar sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. B. R. Miguel Angel is a young man of 27 years. He lives with hsi parents in the well known region of Villa Candelaria, located north of the city of Cochababma. Miguel is a young man and he works while he attends school. On his spare time in the evenings he attends languages classes. Miguel is single and he is a student completing his studies in Business Administration. Miguel is a sales executive for Beicruz, the company where he has worked his April 9, 2008. Through his work he has demonstrated an aptitude for efficiency, efficacy, and punctuality. Miguel also sells parts and accessories for electronics. The loan that he requests will be used to purchase accessories and parts for electronics so that he may resell them with a good margin of profit. Miguel's goal is to have a carer and he would also like to open an electronics store so that he can be his own boss and make his own money.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for his business.

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.es: Vitaliana, de 44 años de edad, es viuda y padre de cuatro hijos. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tiene su techo propio. A Vitaliana nunca le ha gustado depender de nadie, ya que ella misma se la consigue por su propia cuenta, desde luego que su gran fortaleza son sus hijos, debido a que lo motiva a trabajar constantemente en su chacra, en donde cultiva y comercializa su producto de cacao, por el cual  recibe buenas ganancias, incluso cuenta con clientes que siempre compra su producción. Espera con el tiempo ampliar su producción de cacao a gran escala, adquiriendo nuevos terrenos de cultivo y de esa forma mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Pero por el momento continuara trabajando duro y parejo, de esa manera con lo ahorros ganados pueda cumplir su objetivo trazado. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita la ayuda de sus peones para que lo puedan facilitar la extracción de cacao y luego venderlos en los centros de acopio de su propia localidad. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además augura buenos éxitos a su grupo comunal, por la solidaridad y responsabilidad que existe. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos, para que de esa forma le dé un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Vitaliana, age 44, is a widow. She has four children, and they live in the beautiful tropical Peruvian jungle. She has her own home in the Santa Rosa area. Vitaliana has never liked depending on anyone else; she can do things for herself. Her children are her great strength. They are her motivation for constantly working on her farm. She grows and sells cacao. She gets good earnings from this, and she has customers who always buy her product. In time she hopes to increase her cacao production on a large scale. She wants to get new land to cultivate. This will improve her family’s quality of life. For the moment she will continue working hard and consistently. That way, with her savings, she will be able to reach her planned objective. Sometimes her children help her, but during the harvest season she needs workers to help her collect the cacao. The cacao is later sold at local collection centers. This is her second loan with MFP. She pledges to faithfully make her payments. Also, she predicts good success for her communal bank because of the existing solidarity and sense of responsibility. She will use the requested loan to buy supplies and fertilizers. That way she will give her cacao crops adequate maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide adequate maintenance on her cacao crops

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario vive en la zona las lomas de la ciuada de La Paz; tiene dos hijos pero vive sola, está separada del esposo; la actividad que realiza es la venta de celulares y con esta actividad ella se mantiene sola y cubre todas sus necesidades.
El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más celulares para así poder mantener esta fuente de ingresos. Hasta la fecha son 10 los créditos que le han sido otorgados  desde el año 2007 por Impro y fue parte de Kiva en dos oportunidades.

Por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito nuevo.
texts.en:
Rosario lives in the Las Lomas region of La Paz. She lives alone as she is separated from her husband and her two children do not live with her. She is in the business of cell phone sales and with this income, she supports herself and covers all of her expenses. She will use the loan to increase her capital and purchase additional cell phones in order to maintain this source of income. Since 2007, she has received 10 loans through IMPRO, including two loans through Kiva. Her character and reputation qualify her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of cell phones for re-sale.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
La señora Felicidad vive en la zona las lomas de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia; esta casada y tiene 4 hijos todos casados, el esposo trabaja como chofer de transporte libre con su  minibús, ella tiene en la parte inferior de su casa una pensión donde ella vende almuerzos todos los días; es clientes de Impro desde hace más de tres años y son casi 10 créditos  los que se le han concedido durante este tiempo; también fue cliente de kiva en tres oportunidades. 
El crédito que solicita ahora es para comprar papa, fideo, arroz al por mayor para abaratar los costos, y también para comprar carne, aceite y verduras.

Ella esta satisfecha con su relación con Impro y con Kiva, pues abarata mucho el crédito, y por el carácter social del mismo puede acceder a un crédito nuevo.
texts.en:
Felicidad lives in her own home in the Las Lomas neighborhood of the city of La Paz. She is married and has 4 children who are all married. Her husband works as a public transportation driver with his minibus, and in the back of her house, Felicidad has a home-based restaurant where she sells meals every day. They have been clients of IMPRO for more than 3 years, and they have taken out about 10 loans over this time. They have also had 3 loans funded by Kiva. The loan that she requests now is to buy potatoes, noodles and rice at wholesale to reduce her costs, and also to buy meat, cooking oil and vegetables. Felicidad is pleased with her relationship with IMPRO and with Kiva, since it reduces the cost of her credit, and with her good character and reputation she can qualify to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy potatoes, noodles and rice at wholesale, and also to buy meat, cooking oil, and vegetables for the home-based restaurant where she prepares and sells meals

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, de 34 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposa Maday de 25 años y su único hijo Jhon de 3 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeño Wilfredo aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Él siembra Café y plátano, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender al mercado de la ciudad de La Merced. Han transcurrido 10 años y aún le gusta cosechar, además procura siempre cuidar sus campos de la plaga de insectos que afecta su producción. Su mayor deseo es comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda trasladar sus productos hasta el mercado. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuota de humor en el grupo. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 34 years old and a modest hardworking gentleman. He lives at his parents’ house with his wife Maday, age 25, and their only child Jhon who is 3 years old. Wilfredo wants to provide them with a better quality of life. From a young age he learned how to work on a farm. His parents taught him everything he needed to know about achieving a good crop. Now he has his own land that he cultivates and cares for with much love and patience. Wilfredo grows coffee and bananas, products that are eventually sold at the market in the city of La Merced. He has been farming for 10 years and says he enjoys the harvesting season, but he must constantly take care of his fields to protect them from plagues of insects that can impact his production. His greatest wish is to buy a vehicle so that he can transport his goods to market.

This is his third loan with MFP. Wilfredo knows that he must always submit his payments on time and he is happy to comply. He is one of the more cheerful members of his Communal Bank and always adds a sense of humor to his group. The loan of 2500 PEN that he requested will used to buy more compost so that he can improve the quality of his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Angel solicitó  US$1200,  para la compra de computadoras; Angel vive solo  en la zona Villa Bolivar de la ciudad de El Alto; tiene dos hijos de 8 y 12 años. Tiene un servicio de imprenta e Internet. El destino del crédito es la ampliación de su negocio, para lo que requiere comprar otra computadora que le permita mejorar sus ingresos. Es el octavo crédito en impro y el tercero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Angel is asking for a loan of US$1200 to buy computers. He lives alone in the Villa Bolivar area of the city of El Alto. He has two children, aged 8 and 12. He has a print shop/Internet cafe. He will use this loan to expand his business and buy a new computer in order to increase his income. This is his eighth loan with Impro and his third through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer for his Internet Cafe

loans.name: Mario Ivan

texts.es:
Mario de 45 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada de un estero salado) el tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Mario comenzó vendiendo arroz, bebidas y otros víveres para poder mantener a sus dos hijos y esposa que le ayuda en el negocio. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm. Vende bebidas, granes y otros vives. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas y granos para mejorar y surtir su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande y surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Mario is 45 years old. He lives along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil (a periurban area that is situated near a salt marsh). He runs a small store out of the back of his home. He started out by selling rice, drinks, and other supplies to earn money to support his two children and wife who also helps with the business. He works from 6 in the morning to 9 at night. He sells drinks, grains, and other items. Mario plans to use the loan to buy more drinks and grains to better stock his store. He would like to see his business grow and offer more products in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy drinks and grains

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es: Por favor, escribe pequeña historia con la información arriba (en el orden del resumen): Avelino solicito 1200 $us, para la compra de ganado, ya que aparte de la agricultura se dedica a la producción de leche, la cual la vende a Pil Andina, planta industrializadota de leche, vive con su esposa y su hijo en su comunidad denominada POKE que se encuentra situada  dos horas de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz. Es el primer crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Avelino is asking for a loan of US$1200 to buy cows. As well as being a farmer, he also raises cows for milk which he sells to Pil Andina, an industrial milk plant. Avelino lives with his wife and son in the community of Poke which is located two hours from the city of La Paz. This is his first loan with both Impro and Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy two cows to increase milk production

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet, de 38 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Severo de 40 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Yanet comienza con el cuidado de sus tierras, ya que sabe que de la calidad de los productos que cosecha como papa y arveja dependerán las ganancias que obtenga por su venta. Sus cultivos los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es donde mejores precios obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, siente que el préstamo le será muy beneficioso y así poco a poco podrá mejorar su vida. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de sus pagos. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Yanet is 38 years old and she is a very simple and hard working person. She lives in her own house together with her husband, Severo, aged 40, and their three beloved children. They are her strength and the reason for her efforts. Every day since very early in the morning Yanet tends to the fields very well knowing that her earnings depend on the quality of the harvest of potatoes and peas. She takes the harvest to the markets to sell on a wholesale basis, in the city of Tarma. That is where she gets the best prices. What she most enjoys is sowing the seeds. She has been working in this occupation for the past 25 years. The hardest part of her work is having to transport the harvest. With time she hopes to purchase more land to increase production. This is her third credit with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She indicates that this loan will be very helpful in improving their quality of life, one step at a time. She is a very responsible member of her community bank, always committing to her payments being on time. With the two thousand neuvos soles she will purchase fertilizer to improve the yield.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: Willma solicito 750 $us, se dedica a la venta  de  productos alimenticios en los días de feria que se realiza los días  lunes, miércoles, sábado y domingo, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su hija en la ciudad de El Alto . El crédito lo destinara como capital de trabajo para la adquisición de más mercadería y así incrementar sus ventas. Es el segundo crédito en impro y el segundo vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Wilma requests a loan of $750 US. She sells prepared foods on days when street markets convene, on Mondays, Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays. She lives with her parents in their house, alongside her daughter in the city of El Alto. This loan will be invested as working capital and it will be used towards the purchase of merchandise, to improve sales. This is her second loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables in greater quantities to meet client demand.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio solicito 450 $us; se dedica a la confección de chompas de lana en poca escala, trabaja junto a su esposa y sus hijos mayores, vive en una casa en calidad de cuidador en la zona Pedro D. Murillo de la ciudad de El Alto, ya que los dueños se encuentran fuera de la ciudad; el crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de lana de color para diversificar sus ofertas de chompas, y así poder incrementar sus venta Es el Octavo crédito en impro y el tercero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Julio requests a loan of $450 US. He makes and sells wool sweaters on a small scale. He works together with his wife and their eldest children. They live in a house where they are caretakers, located in the Pedro D. Murillo district in the city of El Alto. The owners of the house do not live in the city. This loan will be used to purchase colored wool to add variety to the sweaters they sell. In this manner they hope to increase their sales. This is their eighth loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool in various colors

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis solicito  850 $us, para la compra de una maquina  bordadora, es soltero no tiene  hijos;  el destino del crédito es la compra de una maquina bordadora  y así ampliar los ofertas de servicio de costura con que trabaja; es el primer crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.  Luis es soltero y vive en la ciudad de El Alto.
texts.en:
Luis requests a loan of $850 US to purchase an embroidery machine. He is single and he does not have children. This loan will be used to purchase an embroidery machine so that he can expand the variety of services he offers in his tailoring shop. This is the first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner). Luis is single and he lives in the city of El Alto.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine.

loans.name: September 3 Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “3 de Septiembre” tiene como presidenta a la señora Beatriz, la mencionada asociación pertenece al Centro Focal de Collpani.
