La señora Beatriz es líder en su asociación desde hace años y lo que más le gusta es compartir con las compañeras.  A sus treinta y cinco años, cumple diferentes roles además de ser presidenta, es esposa, madre de dos niños, además de llevar adelante su propio negocio.  
Su negocio de repostería fue iniciado con capital propio, habiendo tomado capacitación para trabajar en Repostería.

La señora Beatriz vende sus productos a las tiendas por mayor, de forma ambulante. Sus primer crédito fue de 1000 Bs. y actualmente la solicitud aprobada fue de 1500 Bs. para la compra de fuentes, aceite y harina.

Las integrantes de la asociación comunal, son nueve mujeres. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: venta de comida, artesania, repostería, tienda de barrio, confección de carteras de cuero, artículos varios, tejidos, atención de Internet
texts.en:
The Community Bank named September 3 has Beatriz as its president. This community bank is a member of the Centro Focal de Collpani. Beatriz has been the leader of the group for many years. She most enjoys working with the other members of the group. She is thirty five years old and she takes on various roles. Aside from being president of the group, she is also a wife, a mother of two children, and the manager of her own business. She started up her pastry business with her own savings. She took pastry classes before starting the business. Beatriz sells her pastries to various stores on a wholesale basis, and she also sells door to door. Her first loan was in the amount of 1000 Bs. Her loan request now is in the amount of 1500 Bs to purchase baking wares, cooking oil and flour. There are nine members of this community bank. They all have different business types, such as: catering, crafts, pastries, convenience store, leather wallets, sales of various articles, knitting, and internet services.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bake wares, cooking oil, and pastry flour.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 40 años de edad, vive en compañía de su esposo y su hija en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años trabaja vendiendo ropa y lo realiza por medio de pedido. Su forma de trabajo consiste en llevar muestras de ropa a la casa de sus vecinas y amigas, para que ella viendo las prendas se anime a comprar uno. Una de abastecerse de esta mercadería, es que cada cierto tiempo viaja hasta los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de Lima, adquiriendo nuevas prendas con diseños nuevos, modelos que son del agrado de sus clientes. En un futuro ella espera seguir mejorando su negocio pues le agrada mucho realizarlo y ella piensa en que puede resultarle muy bien a futuro. Es su onceavo crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita,  comprará mayor cantidad de prendas y de esa manera sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Flor, 40, lives with her husband and daughter in her own home. For four years she has sold clothing based on prior customer orders. Her method of working is to take samples to show her friends and neighbors so that they might be encouraged to order something once they see the samples. Every so often she travels to the city of Lima to stock up on merchandise; she buys items of current design, styles that her customers like. In the future, she’d like to continue to improve her clothing sales because she enjoys this work very much and feels it could be quite profitable in the future. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she pledges to be very punctual with her repayments. The requested loan will be used to buy more articles of clothing thus increasing her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more articles of clothing in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson solicito 1000 $us, para la compra de ganado, ya que aparte de la agricultura se dedica a la producción de leche, la cual la vende a Pil Andina, planta industrializadota de leche; Nelson vive con su esposa e hijos en su comunidad que se llama POKE,que se encuentra a situada  dos horas de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz. Es el primer crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Nelson requested a $1000 USD loan to buy cattle because, besides farming, he also sells milk to Pil Andina, an industrial milk processor. Nelson lives with his wife and children in a community called POKE that is located two hours away from the city of La Paz. This is his first loan with Impro and the first through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two medium quality dairy cows to increase milk production.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia solicito 800 $us,; se dedica a la prestación de servicios en su salón de peinados, el cual esta ubicado en la casa de sus padres. Su esposo trabaja como técnico en una empresa de televisión . El crédito lo destinara como capital de trabajo para la adquisición de materiales, como ser jabones, champúes y otros para  el trabajo diario que realiza. Es el primer crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Sonia requested $800 USD. She has a beauty salon located in her parents’ house. Her husband works as technician at a television company. The loan will be used to buy supplies like soaps, shampoos and others for the work she does. This is her first loan with Impro and first through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soaps, shampoos, disinfectants and other products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Milta Cristina

texts.es:
Milta de 55 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada de un estero salado), ella tiene una tienda variada. 

Ella comenzó con una vitrina vendiendo cuadernos y artículos para papelería, poco a poco fue surtiendo su local con víveres, hasta ahora que tiene una pequeña tienda surtida con víveres y papelería, trabaja sola todos los días. 

Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar productos de uso personal Yambal para poder vender en su tienda, como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande su tienda y surtida.
texts.en:
Milta, 55, lives along Guayaquil’s beltway (a periurban area surrounded by a salty estuary). She owns a general store. She started out with just a display case selling notebooks and stationery items. Gradually she stocked up on foodstuffs and now has a small store that’s stocked with foodstuffs and stationery items. She works unassisted every day. To better stock her store she wants to buy Yambal brand personal use items like perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc. In the future, she’d like her store to be larger and better stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For perfumes, creams and deodorants.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanesa, trabaja como empleada en un hotel, estudia contabilidad, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres en la Ciudad de El Alto. Trabaja como empleada en el Hotel Sucre de la ciudad de La Paz. El préstamo será usado para el pago de la mensualidad en el Instituto de Contabilidad donde estudia contabilidad y actualmente cursa el segundo año de estudios. Es cliente nuestra desde el año 2008.

Es el Cuarto crédito con IMPRO y el segundo via Kiva.
texts.en:
Vanesa is employed in a hotel. She also studies Accounting. She’s single and lives with her parents in the city of El Alto. She works at Sucre Hotel in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to pay for monthly tuition costs at the Accounting Institute where she is studying Accounting; she’s in her second year of studies. She has been a client of ours since 2008. This is her 4th loan with IMPRO and second via Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay monthly tuition costs to continue Accounting classes.

loans.name: 6 De Enero Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en el 5° ciclo ellas se encuentran trabajando cada una en  sus actividades de manera a que todas pueden tener un ingreso y así ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes de quien se puede hablar es la Sra. Faustina B. con 55 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos ella  vende ropas con su hija, pero ahora está por montar su propio local en su casa para estar más cerca de su hijo adolecente y trabajar todo en familia.
Tiene casa propia pero es madre soltera, de esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  su hijo  que va en la secundaria. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para la venta de ropas como camisas, pantalones, suéter, camperas y otros.
texts.en:
This group is on its fifth loan cycle. Each one of the members works in their own business and they earn an income for their family. One of the members is Mrs. Faustina Bordon. She is 55 years old and she has 3 children. She sells clothing alongside her daughter but she would like to set up a store in a section of their house so that she can be closer to her teenage son. She wants the whole family to work together. She owns her own house but she is a single mother. She is responsible for all of the household expenses and her son's high school tuition. She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as shirts, slacks, sweaters, jackets and other items of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sweaters, jackets, shirts and other items of clothing.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 36 años, comparte su vida con su esposo y sus tres hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años que tiene una bodega, actividad a la que se dedica con mucho esfuerzo, además de ser muy estricta y ordenada a la hora de administrar sus ingresos. Su firma de trabajo le ha dado mucha satisfacción, y cada vez que puede lo implementa de más productos, siempre pensando en la necesidad del cliente y en su economía. En un futuro ha pensado en ampliar su tienda e instalar una librería y artículos para el hogar, para así lograr mejores ventas, pues esta actividad es de gran ayuda para la economía familiar. Es su onceavo crédito con MFP y se compromete de a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos para así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old. She shares her life with her husband and with their three children, and they own their own home. For more than 3 years she has been running a grocery store. She invests herself in this business with all her strength and she is very organized and disciplined when it comes to administering the business. Her business has provided her with a great deal of satisfaction. Whenever she can she incorporates even more products, all the while trying to anticipate the clients' needs and on the financial situation. In the future she would like to expand the store to also sell books and products for the home. All of this will improve her sales and it will help the family's finances. This is her eleventh loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to the obligations of this loan. With this loan she is requesting she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to restock her store.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Luis Antonio Trabaja como obrero en una Maquiladora de la localidad, es un hombre muy trabajador. Su esposa la señora Rosalva también trabaja, ella labora como encargada de una tienda de abarrotes.  Entre los dos solventan los gastos del hogar, solo tienen una pequeña hija pero se preocupan por darle una mejor calidad de vida y tratan de ir poco a poco hacerle mejoras a la vivienda de interés social que el Señor Luis Antonio esta pagando. Requieren de este crédito para la colocación de Vitro piso en el frente de su casa. La Familia R. les agradece su Apoyo.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio works as a laborer at a manufacturing plant in his region. He is a very hard working person. His wife Rosalva also works. She is the manager of a convenience store. Between the two of them they manage to cover all the household expenses. They have only one little girl but their wish is to give her a better quality of life and they try to improve their living space. He requires this loan to install a tile floor in the front of their house. The R. family is grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile flooring in his home.

loans.name: Martiniano

texts.es: El Señor Martiniano es un hombre muy trabajador, el es albañil y trabaja mucho para darle a su nieto una buena educación, ya que el pequeño vive con el, por que los padres del menor  lo dejaron a cargo del Señor Martiniano, el vive solo con su nieto, son muy unidos y el señor esta preocupado por la compra de Útiles escolares de este nuevo ciclo escolar.  Necesita de este préstamo para comprar  el uniforme de la escuela, así como zapatos y también los útiles escolares. El señor Martiniano esta muy agradecido con el apoyo que le puedan brindar.
texts.en:
Martiniano is a very hard working man. He is a construction worker and he works long hours to provide his grandson with a good education. The little boy lives with him after his parents left him in his care. He lives alone with his grandson. They are very close but he is concerned about needing to purchase school supplies for the new school year. He needs this loan so that he can purchase a uniform, shoes, and school supplies for the boy. Martiniano is very grateful for the support they receive.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Ms. Hilda is separated and has grown up children; she lives alone. She is dedicated to the tayloring of garments, and for more than five years she has been devoted to this área.
She began in this area with her brother who also has a sewing workshop, but with her savings, she managed to gain Independence and open her own workshop.
She needs this loan for a purchase of an industrial machine and with it she will have in stocks because she has many orders. In the future she wants to have a boutique.
texts.en:
Ms. Hilda is separated and has grown children; she lives alone. She is dedicated to the tailoring of garments, and for more than five years she has been devoted to this occupation. She started out in this occupation with her brother who also has a tailorin workshop. With her own savings, she managed to open her own shop. She needs this loan to purchase an industrial sewing machine. With it she will have many more orders. In the future she wants to open a boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson, es portero en una empresa, tiene una hija de 11 años. Wilson es casado; esta postulando en la universidad donde quiere estudia agronomía. Vive en la ciudad de El Alto. Trabaja como portero en una empresa de productos lácteos. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado en la compra de una computadora que le será muy útil cuando ingrese a la Universidad.

Es el Cuarto crédito con IMPRO y el segundo via Kiva.
texts.en:
Wilson is a security guard at a private company. He has a daughter who is 11 years old. He is married and he is going to university where he is studying agriculture. He lives in the city of El Alto. He works as a security guard for a milk products company. The loan he is requesting is to purchase a computer to use for his university studies. This is his fourth loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer to use while in University.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a wall in front of his house.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, de 40 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, sus 3 hijos y su padre. La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa casual a sus amigos y familiares y  los fines de semana  disponen de su tiempo para vender tamales (platillo típico de Lima). Muy temprano por la mañana realiza sus compras, y en seguida lava las hojas, en la que envuelve los tamales. Le gusta su  trabajo, puesto que tiene mucha acogida por parte de sus clientes, por tanto es que Raquel trabaja en compañía de su familia, mientra ella hace el aderezo su esposo muele el maíz. Más adelante quiere poner reja a su puerta, para la seguridad de su casa y de su negocio. Es su noveno crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas, como lo estuvo haciendo, puesto que sabe que le es de mucha utilidad para el progreso de su negocio. Con este crédito que solicita, renovar sus utensilios de cocina, para continuar con la venta de tamales, además comprar más prendas de vestir para su negocio.
texts.en:
Raquel is 40 years old. She is a very hard working Mom. She lives in her own house together with her husband, their 3 children and her father. She sells casual clothing to her friends and family and on the weekends she sells tamales (a popular dish in Lima). In the very early in the morning she goes shopping and then she washes the corn husks that will hold the tamales. She enjoys her work, especially because her business is very well patronized by her clients. Raquel works alongside her family. While she makes the sauce her husband mills the corn. In the future she hopes to install a gate at her door, to make her house and business safe. She is committed to the obligations of this loan, as she always has. She knows that these loans key to the progress of her business. With this loan she will purchase new kitchen tools so that she may continue making tamales. She would also like to have more table cloths to dress up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: El señor Gustavo y su esposa son personas muy trabajadoras, el trabaja en una maquiladora como operador y su esposa tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Ellos ven por el patrimonio de sus hijos y para darles una mejor calidad de vida requieren de la colocación del techo de un cuarto más en su vivienda, para darles mayor comodidad a sus tres hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
Gustavo and his wife are very hard working people. He works at a manufacturing plan as an operator and his wife runs a convenience store from their house. They look after the necessities of their children, to provide them with a better quality of life. They need to install a roof over a room in their house. They wish to provide their three little children with greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a tile floor.

loans.name: Romel

texts.es: Romel solicito un  300 $us, para la compra de repuestos de movilidad.  y así  mejorar su servicio para con sus clientes, ya que por el constante uso  su minibús presenta fallas mecánicas; su esposa se dedica al cuidado de su hijo. Es el primer crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva. La familia vive en la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Romel requests a loan of $300 US to purchase spare parts for his minibus, so that he will improve service to his clients. He is in constant use of the minibus and it is showing some mechanical problems. His wife is dedicated to the care of their son. This is his first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner). The family lives in the city of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To carry out maintenance repairs to his minibus.

loans.name: Sara De La Concepcion

texts.es: Sara De La Concepción tiene 58 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de transporte. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, en este último trabajo, ella tiene que depositar todo su esfuerzo para proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos diarios, a pesar de tener a una persona que conduzca el taxi ella está al pendiente de lo que su taxi necesita, sus planes a futuro es tener una tienda, en donde pueda obtener otro negocio, además considera que es más rentable que el negocio actual que tiene. Este es el primer crédito y se compromete pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas, así podrá invertir en la compra de llantas, focos y chequeo general.
texts.en:
Sara De La Concepción, 58, provides taxi services. She has been in this business for over 4 years. To provide her family with daily income she must put all her efforts into this last job. Despite having someone to actually drive the taxi she must take care to see that everything the taxi needs is provided. Her plans for the future are to have a store in order to have an additional business because she feels it would be more profitable than her current one. This is her first loan and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion so that she can invest the funds in buying tires, headlamps and for a general service check-up.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires, headlamps and pay for service and repair charges.

loans.name: Janina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Janima de 23 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), tiene una tienda de víveres en la ventana de su casa. 

Ella comenzó con una vitrina vendiendo dulces y bebidas, poco a poco fue surtiendo su local con víveres, hasta ahora que tiene una pequeña tienda surtida en la ventana de su casa vende dulces, bebidas, granos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas, legumbres para mejorar y surtir su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande y surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Janima, 23, lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a hilly periurban area with unpaved streets). She has a grocery store in her home. She started out with just a display case selling candy and beverages. Gradually she stocked foodstuffs. She now has a small stocked store that she operates out of one of her home’s windows; she sells candy, beverages and grains. She wants to use the loan to buy rice, beverages and vegetables to improve and better stock her store. In the future she’d like her store to be larger and better stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice and beverages.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel de 39 años de edad vive en la colonia la Esperanza a 12 km de Nueva Guinea, tiene 3 hijos ltodos estudiando la primaria, su esposo se desempeña como acopiador de leche  para luego entregarla a la la empresa Lacteos el Zapote. Maribel labora como docente de primaria desde hace 20 años en la Escuela Deyling Olivas Betancourth en la colonia la Esperanza desempeñandose con gran dedicacion y empeño. 

Actualmente està  solicitando su 6to crèdito para construir una cocina con mejores condiciones ya que actualmente no cuenta con una. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida  es que su familia permanezca unida y poco a poco ir mejorando sus condicones familiares.
texts.en:
Maribel is 39 years old and lives in the district of la Esperanza, 12 km from New Guinea. She has 3 children, all of whom are in elementary school, and a husband who works collecting milk which he then gives to the company Lacteos el Zapote. Maribel has been working as a primary school teacher for 20 years at the Deyling Olivas Betancourth school in the district of la Esperanza. She works with great dedication and determination. At present she is requesting her sixth loan to build a better kitchen because at the moment she doesn't have one. Her greatest dream in life is that her family stays together and little by little continues improving their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kitchen

loans.name: Teresa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Teresa  de 41 años de edad, labora como docente de primaria en la escuela Deyling Olivas Betancourth de Nueva Guinea desde hace 22 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos los cuales dependen econòmicamente de ella, actualmente el mayor de 20 años esta estudiando su primer año en la universidad y la menor de 13 años estudia su 6to grado de primaria en la misma escuela donde ella labora.  

Teresa està solicitando su 8vo credito para comprar materiales de construcciòn y asì lograr construir una habitaciòn en su casa que le permita brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia.  Teresa se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer bien trabajadora y muy querida por sus vecinos y padres de familias de sus alumnos.
texts.en:
Teresa, 41, has worked as an elementary school teacher at Nueva Guinea’s Deyling Olivas Betancourth School for 22 years. She is a single mother of two children who depend economically on her. Her oldest son, 20, is currently in his first year of university and her youngest daughter, 13, is enrolled in the same elementary school where Teresa works. Teresa is asking for her 8th loan to buy building materials and supplies in order to add a room to her house thus allowing greater comfort for her family. Teresa is known for being a hard working woman who is well liked by her neighbors and her students’ parents.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Don Juan Antonio  de  44 años de edad es casado, habita junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y su unico hijo de seis añitos de edad el cual esta cursando su segundo grado de educaciòn primaria en la Escuelita Jan Amos Comenius del municipio Nueva Guinea.  Juan labora como fiscal de campo en el INTA  desde hace 12 años. 

Està solicitando su 6to crèdito para invertirlo en su pequeña casa, comprando materiales de construccion para hacer un corredor en su casa y que su pequeño tenga donde jugar. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es tener estabilidad laboral y poco a poco ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio, 44, is married and lives with his family, which includes his wife and 6 year-old only son. His son is in second grade at Nueva Guinea’s Jan Amos Comenius School. Juan has worked for 12 years as a Field Supervisor at INTA. He is requesting his 6th loan to invest in his home. He will buy building materials and supplies to build a passageway so that his son will have a place to play. His greatest wish is to have job security and gradually improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to build a passageway.

loans.name: Mercidia

texts.es: Mercida tiene 59 años, es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos ya mayores de edad. La señora tiene 25 años de dedicarse de tener de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo se siente muy tranquila con este negocio.  Hace más 8 años con este negocio, Su negocio nace debido a la necesidad de empleo por lo que con el paso del tiempo es que ha mejorado, ahora cuenta con una gran variedad de clientes. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, calzado, sabanas y toallas.
texts.en:
Mercidia, 59, is a single mother of six children who are all adults. She has sold general merchandise for 25 years. This, then, isn’t her first time requesting financing and she feels quite secure in her business. She has had this particular enterprise for over 8 years. It grew from her need to have employment and with time it’s improved. Now she can count on a large variety of regular customers. The funds will be used to buy pants, shirts, skirts, shoes, sheets and towels.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, skirts, shoes, sheets and towels.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es viuda y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 1 vive con ella y estudia, Alejandra tiene una tienda en el Barrio de Mollepata en donde vende verduras, frutas, abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Alejandra viaja al Distrito de Huamanguilla en donde vende verduras, frutas y también compra cereales que luego vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y fideos.
El sueño de Alejandra son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a widow and has four children one of whom is a student and still lives with her. She has a grocery store in Mollepata neighborhood where she sells vegetables, fruits and assorted groceries every day. In addition, Alejandra travels to Huamanguilla district to sell fruits and vegetables and sometimes buys cereals that she then resells in Ayacucho’s wholesale foodstuffs market. The loan will be used to buy rice, sugar and pasta. Her dream is that her children become professionals and to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and pasta.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es casada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian, Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro y lo que mas le agrada son las capacitaciones.
Antonia es de la comunidad de Chanquil y se dedica a la venta de quesos que compra en su comunidad y también produce, Antonia para la mayor parte de su tiempo en la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde estudian sus hijos, y los días sábados y domingos en su pueblo en donde se dedica a la siembra y crianza de animales, el mayor sueño de Antonia es comprar un terreno en la ciudad de Ayacucho para que sus hijos tengan mas comodidad, pues hasta la fecha vive en casa alquilada. El préstamo que solicita será invertido en la compra de ganado.
texts.en:
Antonia is married and has 6 kids, 4 of whom are in school. Antonia is a member of the Communal Bank Futuro and the thing she likes the most are the training sessions. Antonia is from the community of Chanquil and works selling cheese, which she both produces and buys from her community. Antonia spends the majority of her time in the city of Ayacucho where her children study. On Saturdays and Sundays she spends her time in her town where she works planting crops and raising animals. Antonia's greatest dream is to buy land in the city of Ayacucho so her children can have more comfort. As of today she rents the house they live in. The loan she is requesting will be invested in cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Máxima es casada, tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Máxima es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro hace 10 años y lo que aprendió en este tiempo es ser puntual.
Máxima tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la noche.
Máxima necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, jabón.
Los sueños de Máxima son tener casa propia pues vive en casa alquilada.
texts.en:
Máxima is married and has two children who are students. She has been a member of the “Futuro” (Future) communal bank for 10 years. What she learned during this time is to be punctual. Máxima has a stand in the 12 de Abril market where she sells groceries every day from 7am until 6pm. Máxima needs a 1500 sol loan to buy rice, sugar, pasta, cooking oil and soap. Her dream is to own her own house since she currently rents her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, pasta, cooking oil, soap.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro hace 10 años y lo que aprendió en este tiempo es ser puntual.
Nancy vende golosinas y frutas en la puerta de su casa que se encuentra cerca del Colegio Libertadores, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Nancy tiene una mototaxi con la cual trabaja su esposo realizando transporte. Nancy tiene proyectado ampliar su negocio con la venta de algunos productos mas.
Nancy solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo.
Nancy tiene una casa de material rustico y su mayor sueño es tener una casa de material noble.
texts.en:
Nancy has a live-in life partner and four children who are students. She has been a member of the “Futuro” (Future) communal bank for 10 years and she learned to be punctual in this time. Nancy sells sweets and fruit in the dorrwoay of her house, which is located near Libertadores School, every day. In addition, Nancy has a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) that her husband drives providing transportation services. Nancy plans to expand her sales by adding a few additional products to her stock. Nancy requests a 1000 sol loan to buy rice, sugar and pasta. Nancy’s home is made of flimsy materials and her greatest dream is to have a house made with substantial materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, pasta.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro y lo que mas le agrada es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro.
Rosa es viuda y tiene 6 hijos, Rosa tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donde vende carne, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la tarde.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne de res y cerdo.
Rosa sueña con mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Futuro” (Future) communal bank. What she likes best is the ease of payments and the savings. Rosa is a widow and has 6 children. She has a stand in Magdalena Market where she sells meat every day from 7am until late afternoon. Rosa needs a 2000 sol loan to buy beef and pork. She dreams with improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef and pork.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es casada y tiene 5 hijos que ya son profesionales y ahora solo vive con su esposo, Felicitas tiene un taller D. confecciones en su casa, confecciona ropa típica como centros ayacuchanos, en una semana confecciona 2 centros, dependiendo D. la demanda tiene personas que le ayudan, sus productos los venD. en los mercados D. acuerdo a pedidos, también lleva a las ferias.
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro y solicita un préstamo D. 1000 soles para la compra D. telas.
Felicitas sueña con producir mas y tener materia prima variada.
texts.en:
Felicitas is married and has five children who are already professionals; she lives alone with her husband. Felicitas has a shop in her home where she makes typical regional clothing. In a week she can finish two items. Depending on demand she might employ people to help her. Her products are sold in the markets according to prior orders and she also takes them to flea markets to sell. Felicitas is a member of the “Futuro” (Future) communal bank and is asking for a 1000 sol loan to buy fabric. Felicitas dreams with producing more and having a variety of raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro y lo que mas le gusta son los ahorros.
Concepción es casada y tiene 4 hijos, vive con la hija menor, Concepción junto a su esposo realizan artesanías en telar, sus productos los vende en la ciudad de Lima de acuerdo a pedidos, además hace hilados de lana de oveja que vende por kilos.
Concepción necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilo y lana.
Concepción sueña con producir mas cantidad.
texts.en:
Concepción is a member of the “Futuro” (Future) communal bank; what she likes best about it are the savings. Concepción is married and has 4 children. She lives with her youngest daughter. Concepción and her husband are weavers. They sell their items in the city of Lima based on prior orders. She also sells spun wool by the kilo. Concepción needs a 1000 sol loan to buy thread and wool. Concepción dreams with producing more.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread and wool.

loans.name: Pedro Giancarlo

texts.es: Pedro tiene 23 años  de edad, es soltero vive  aun con sus padres en el Caserio de Garganto, en casa de material noble de un piso. El se dedica a prestar servcio de transporte en vehiculo en condicion de alquiler venta. Tambien se dedica como mecanico. El es un joven muy activo con muchas metas y objetivos. Con el dinero que solicita sera para terminar de cancelar el vehiculo que es un automovil tico.
texts.en:
Pedro, 23, is single and still lives with his parents in Garganto in a one-storey house built of substantial materials. He provides public transportation services and also is an auto mechanic. He is a very active young man who has many goals and objectives. He will use the requested funds to pay off his vehicle which is a TIco brand car.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish paying off his car.

loans.name: Glenis Esther

texts.es:
Glenis es una mujer casada y con 4 hijos en las edades de 4 a 15 años, tiene 33 años. Ella es muy reconocida en este pueblo,donde las  ferias artesanales y las fiestas de San Luis Beltrán, constituyen los momentos de la mas alta demanda mercadologica para todos los negocios.

Como  Glenis sabe también confeccionar, ella  inició su emprendimiento justamente con ese arte pero paulatinamente fue agregándole la miscelánea   y allí también vende sus productos de confección, negocio con un   mercado especifico, oxigenado por la miscelánea.

Su credikiva por valor de $ 1.500.000 COP es el segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el anterior  financiamiento, ha podido mejorar su ingreso, porque cuenta como quien dice con un nuevo capital que trabaja y luego devuelve con unas utilidades para ella. Su mayor desafío es la seguridad de su negocio y eso es en lo que se encuentra trabajando para sentirse mas tranquila, porque está justamente a la orilla del pueblo. Es así como con este financiamiento, invertirá en la compra de productos para surtir su negocio en el mes del  amor y amistad y prepararse para este segundo semestre del año, época muy buena para el comercio, donde aumentan sus clientes y hay mayor rotación de su dinero, por eso ella también aprovechará  este recurso,  para hacer unas adecuaciones  a su vivienda y darle mas seguridad para el fin de año.
texts.en:
Glenis, 33, is married and has four children who range from 4 to 15 years of age. She is very well known in town where the crafts fairs and feast days of San Luis Beltrán are the busiest days with highest demand for all types of business. Because Glenis also knows how to sew clothes she started out precisely doing this but gradually added miscellaneous items to sell together with her clothing items. This is a business with a very specific market that is enriched by the miscellany. Her $1.500.000 COP Kiva loan is her second with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Her prior loan allowed her to increase her income because she tells us that new capital to work results in profits for her. Her greatest challenge is her business’ security and that is what she’s working on to feel more relaxed because she's located just at the outskirts of town. She will use these funds to buy stock items for her store during the month of love and friendship so that she can be prepared for the year’s second semester, a very good time for commerce, when customers increase and there is better flow of money. She will take advantage of this resource to also make some adjustments to her home to provide it with better security for the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with children's and teens' clothing, decorations, stationery items and also for locale improvements costs.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan Bautista Rodríguez es un hombre que sabe mucho de las abejas y de producir  miel, eso si bien pura,   y como no,  si se dedica al oficio de apicultor, oficio que aprendió desde muy joven cuando se escapaba del colegio a las fincas para conocer  el comportamiento de las abejas y  de las colmenas;  asì fue como hace 18 años gracias a un funcionario del I.C.A.  (Instituto Colombiano agropecuario)  que llevó este arte a Sabanalarga su pueblo, inició con 10 colmenas, con una inversión de $380.000, y gradualmente fue adquiriendo mas en las poblaciones de Sabanalarga, cascajal, Polonuevo, Caracol, Piojo, Galapa y Manatí, hasta completar  hoy 235,  de dónde saca la pura miel, que él mismo se encarga de empacar en su casa,  ubicada en el municipio de Malambo, en envases de 360 centímetros cúbicos y de 72 respectivamente y las  distribuye en  almacenes de productos naturistas, restaurante vegetarianos , distribuidores mayorista y al granel, a personas que quieren consumirla como parte de su régimen alimenticio .
 Juan Bautista  vende al por mayor mediante el sistema de  consignación y le pagan a los 15 días y al granel  le pagan de contado los frascos de 360 centímetros cúbicos los vende a $8.000 COP y los de 720 centímetros cúbicos  a    $ 16.000  COP. En la actualidad Solicita su credikiva como segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar 4.200 láminas de cera, estampado para los panales  y 1.800 envases de vidrio para empacar la pura miel y prepararse para la cosecha que se inicia en Noviembre.
Juan Bautista aún recuerda como antes sin ninguna protección los apicultores se acercaban a las abejas solo con expeler  un suave humo; esto era, aclara,  cuando no habían abejas africanizadas, hasta que llegaron unos especialistas chinos y los indujeron a ello,  sin importar que fueran abejas criollas o no. Y es que él parte de la premisa que si los humanos no molestamos sus abejas, ellas no atacan pero que de todas maneras él siempre se protege para atender medidas de seguridad. También plantea desde su experiencia como un buen observador y seguidor empírico, que las fugas masivas de abejas en algunas partes del mundo obedecen a que ellas son  muy sensibles a los aparatos electrónicos, celulares y medios modernos que  no lo resisten por su misma naturaleza.
Juan Bautista y su esposa, que trabaja en el arte de confecciones mediante el sistema de maquilas,  con sus esfuerzos han apoyado su hogar y lo han  sacado adelante a sus 3 hijos ya profesionales. Él sueña hoy con    perfeccionar su arte de cultivar abejas para extraer  su rica miel, haciendo el proceso lo más natural posible y convirtiéndolo en un ejemplo internacional.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista Rodríguez is a man who knows a lot about bees and honey production. The honey is very pure, and how could it not be, if he devotes himself to being a beekeeper. He learned this trade when he was very young. He would escape from school and go to the farms to learn about bee behavior and their hives. This was how 18 years ago, thanks to an official from the I.C.A. (Colombian Agricultural Institute) who took this art to his town of Sabanalarga, he started with ten hives with an investment of $380.000. He gradually was acquiring more hives in the towns of Sabanalarga, Cascajao, Polonuevo, Caracol, Piojo, Galapa, and Manatí. He now has 235 from which he takes pure honey. He sees to packing the honey himself. He does this at his home, which is located in the Malambo municipality. He packs the honey in containers that are 360 centimeters by 72 centimeters. He delivers the packages of honey to stores that sell natural products, vegetarian restaurants, wholesale distributors, and in bulk to people who want to eat it as part of their nutritional regimen. Juan Bautista sells wholesale through a consignment system. They pay him every 15 days, and he is paid cash for bulk sales. He sells the bottles that are 360 cubic centimeters for $8.000 COP, and he sells the bottles that are 720 centimeters for $16.000 COP. He is currently requesting his second loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy 4.200 sheets of wax, comb foundation for the honeycomb, and 1.800 glass bottles to pack the pure honey and to prepare to start the harvest in November. Juan Bautista still remembers how beekeepers would approach the bees without any protection by just blowing out mild smoke. “This was,” he says, “when there were not African bees.” That was until some Chinese specialists came and introduced them without caring whether or not they were Columbian bees. Aside from the premise that if humans do not bother the bees they will not attack, he always protects himself in order to comply with security measures. Also, from his experience of being a good observer and empirical follower, he states that the massive flight of bees in some parts of the world is due to the fact that they are very sensitive to electronic apparatus, cell phones, and modern media. By nature they cannot resist them. Juan Bautista and his wife work in the art of making textiles in factories. Through their efforts they have supported their household, and they have gotten their three children, who are now professionals, ahead. He now dreams of perfecting his art of cultivating bees in order to extract their delicious honey. He makes the process as natural as possible, and he will turn it into an international example.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4.200 wax sheets, comb foundation for the honeycomb, and 1.800 glass containers to prepare for the November harvest

loans.name: Gloria  Azucena

texts.es: Gloria Azucena tiene 46 años, su actividad es la venta de talabartería y productos de ferretería. Su negocio está ubicado de la iglesia católica 1 cuadra y media al este, es aquí donde llegan a comprar sus diferentes clientes. Ella dio inicio a este negocio gracias a su esposo ya que él se hacía cargo de la actividad y con el paso del tiempo fue que ella le ayudo a su esposo y ahora ella se hace cargo. Actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de mecates, herraduras, lonas y albardas entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar su negocio y ampliar su inventario cada día más.
texts.en:
Gloria Azucena is 46 years old. She runs a hardware store located on Iglesia Catolica east. Here is where her clients come to buy from her store. It was her husband that started up the business. She started out by helping him in the store but now she is the manager. She is requesting this loan to purchase rope, latches, tarps, and saddles among other items. Every day she dreams of improving her business and adding more variety to her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Iveth Del Rosario

texts.es:
Iveth  de  27 años de edad trabaja para la Universidad URACCAN desde hace 3 años como auxiliar de Biblioteca, tiene un bebe de 2 añitos de edad el cual esta bajo el cuido de la abuelita materna cuando Iveth trabaja, su esposo trabaja como analista de crèdito y se encarga de los gastos del hogar.  

Iveth està solicitando su 2do crèdito para invertirlo en acondicionar mejor una habitaciòn, hecharle el piso y repellarlo, su mayor sueño en la vida es que su hijo crezca sano y saludable, mejorar sus condiciones de vida y seguir estudiando para ser una profesional con mucha experiencia, pues actualmenteestà estudiando un curso de Ingles en la misma universidad donde ella labora.
texts.en:
Iveth, 27, has worked for the Uraccan University for 3 years as an assistant librarian. She has a 2 year-old baby who is cared for by the maternal grandmother when Iveth works. Her husband works as a credit analyst and takes care of the household expenses. Iveth is requesting her 2nd loan to invest in improvements to her home, to put in some flooring and plaster it. Her main dream in life is for her son to grow up safe and healthy, and to improve her living conditions and continue studying to become an experienced professional. She is currently taking a course in English from the same university where she works.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to put in new flooring and plaster in her home

loans.name: Alexei Odalis

texts.es:
Alexei de 24 años de edad es soltero, labora como docente de primaria desde hace 4 años en la Escuela Rafaela Herrera a 34 km de Nueva Guinea, el tiene que viajar  una hora a caballo para llegar a centro de trabajo ya que hasta la colonia la Fonseca llegan los camiones.  

Està  solicitando su 2do  crèdito para construir una  cocina con mejores condiciones en la casa de su mamá, pues aun no ha formado su propia familia y mientras esté a su alcance desea ayudarla en lo mas que pueda, pues desea compensar un poquito los sacrificios que su mamá hizo cuando el era pequeño. 

Alexei  es un joven bien querido por sus alumnos y compañeros de trabajo, caracterizandolo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Alexei is 24, single, and has been working as a primary school teacher for the last 4 years in the Rafaela Herrera school, 34 kilometers from Nueva Guinea. He has to travel an hour on horseback to his work since the buses only go as far as the Fonseca neighborhood. He is asking for his second loan to build a better kitchen in his mother’s house. He doesn’t yet have his own family so while he can, he wants to help her as much as possible. He would like to repay her a little for the sacrifices that she made when he was a child. Alexei is a young man who is well-liked by his students and fellow workers, all of which show how responsible he is.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kitchen

loans.name: Alba Lidia

texts.es:
Doña Alba Lidia de 48 años de edad es casada, solamente su 2 hijos menores dependen econòmicamente de ella, los cuales estudian y le apoyan con los quehaceres del hogar en sus horas libres, Alba labora como docente de primaria desde hace 25 años en la Escuela Deyling Olivas de Nueva Guinea. 

Esta està solicitando su 7mo credito para comprar materiales y construir una habitaciòn en su casa para brindarle mejor comodidad a su linda familia. 

Alba Lidia se caracteriza por ser una mujer bien trabajadora y muy querida por sus vecinos y padres de familias de sus alumnos, su mayor sueño es que sus hijos estudien y sean personas de bien en el futuro.
texts.en:
Doña Alba Lidia is 48 years old and is married. Only her two youngest children depend on her economically, they study and support her with the household chores in their spare hours. Alba has worked as a primary school teacher in the Deyling Olivas de Nueva Guinea school. Alba is seeking her 7th loan to purchase construction materials and build a room in her house so her beautiful family can be more comfortable. Alba Lidia is characterised by her hard-working nature and is greatly loved by her neighbours and parents of her students. Her biggest dream is that her students can study and become good people in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room in her house

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Don Miguel Angel  de 39 años de edad , es casado, vive en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 16, 13 y 7 años de edad, los tres estudian, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y del cuido de los hijos.  Miguel labora como  distrubuidor de jugos y gaseosas a las diferentes pulperias del casco urbano y las colonias aledañas de Nueva Guinea, posee su propio inventario y ademàs cuenta con una camioneta donde distribuye sus productos obteniendo ingresos adicionales de un taxi que posee. 

Està solicitando su 1er crèdito para invertirlo en construcciòn de una habitaciòn para que su hijo mayor tenga privacidad y brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia.  Su mayor sueño en la vida es ver a sus hijos que estudien y lleguen a ser hombres de bien y que no les haga falta lo basico en el hogar. Es muy reconocido en la zona por ser bien trabajador y sociable.
texts.en:
Don Miguel Angel, 39, is married and lives in zone 5 in Nueva Guinea together with his family, composed of his wife and 3 children - 16, 13 and 7 years of age. The three children study and Miguel's wife takes care of the household chores and looks after their children. Miguel works as a juice and soft drink distributor to different grocery stores in his urban zone and the suburbs of Nueva Guinea. He has his own inventory and a truck for him to distribute the products. He obtains additional earnings from the taxi he owns. Miguel is seeking his first loan to invest in constructing a room for his older son to provide greater comfort to his family and so his son has privacy. Miguel's biggest dream in life is to see his children study and become good men, and not lack anything basic in his home. Miguel is well known in his zone for being a sociable and hard-working man.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a room in his house

loans.name: Idalia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Idalia de 34 años de edad es soltera, no tiene hijos, pero esta al pendiente de su mamá a quien con los gastos del hogar.  Idalia trabaja para el INSS Nueva Guinea desde hace 2 años. 

Esta solicitando su 2do crèdito para invertir en la construccion de un dormitorio y hecharle la ceramica a la casa de su mamá, y poco a poco ir mejorando las condiciones de vida tanto de ella como de su madre quien la apoya con este pequeño proyecto. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es tener estabilidad laboral y  seguir profesionalizandose para seguir apoyando a su mamà en lo mas que pueda y retribuir los sacrificios que hizo cuando ella estaba pequeña.
texts.en:
Idalia is 34 years old and is single. She doesn't have children but looks after her mother who she helps with the household costs. Idalia has worked for the Municipality of Nueva Guinea for 2 years. She is seeking her second loan to invest in the construction of a bedroom and to tile her mother's house, little by little improving her conditions of living for her as well as her mother, who is helping her with this small project. Her biggest dream in life is to have stable work and continue becoming a professional to continue supporting her mother as much as she can, and return the sacrifices that her mother made when Idalia was small.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room in her house

loans.name: Cenelia Maria

texts.es:
Cenelia Marìa de 23 años de edad es soltera, vive junto a sus padres, trabaja como docente de primaria en la Escuela Rafaela Herrera desde hace 7 años ubicada en la colonia la Fonseca a 35 km de Nueva Guinea,  

Està solicitando su 5to crèdito para construir  una habitaciòn y asì poco a poco mejorar su nivel de vida, cenelia se ha caracterizado por ser una joven responsable y con muchos deseos de superacion, pues actualmente està cursando su tercer año en la universidad URACCAN  de la licenciatura en ciencias de la Educacion con menciòn en Español. 

Su mayor su sueño en la vida es culminar sus estudios universitarios para obtener mejores ingresos econòmicos y asi poder ayudar a su humilde familia ya que son de escasos recursos y ir mejorando  su vivienda poco a poco.
texts.en:
Cenelia Maria, 23, is single and lives with her parents. She has worked as an elementary school teacher in the Rafaela Herrera school for 7 years. The school is located in the Fonseca neighborhood, 35 kilometers from Nueva Guinea. She is requesting her 5th loan to build a room, and in this way gradually improve her standard of living. Cenelia is known to be a responsible young person with a strong desire to succeed. She is currently completing her 3rd year at the Uraccan University, where she is studying toward a degree in education with a minor in Spanish. Her main wish in life is to finish her university studies so that she can have a better economic status and in this way help her family, since they have limited economic resources. She also wants to continue to make gradual improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción tiene 58 años, tiene 8 hijos con 8 hijos ninguno de sus hijos depende de ella.  Por lo que no es la primera vez que tiene financiamientos, ella nos dice que han sido muy importantes. Su actividad económica es la venta de nacatamales, venta de leche, y carne de cerdo hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios fueron capital propio por lo que tenía que buscar una fuente de ingresos que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos de su familia. Actualmente con este crédito lo utilizara para la compra de leña, maíz y cerdos.
texts.en:
Concepción is 58 years old. She has eight children, none of whom are dependent on her. This is not the first time she has had a loan, and she tells us they have been very important. She has made a living selling tamales, milk and pork for more than 14 years. She started the business with her own money, because she had to find a source of income that would help her cover family expenses. She plans to use this current loan to purchase firewood, corn and pork.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood, corn and pork

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria K. is 62 and married with 6 children who are 17 - 32 years old.  She owns a business planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Maria has five years of experience in this business.  Maria needs a loan of WST $2900 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2006, Maria joined SPBD.  This is her fifth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Maria's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:
 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

With four years of experience in this business, Fetu is requesting a loan, her sixth, of WST $2900 to purchase game prizes. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2006, Fetu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.

About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. "

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita V., from the village of Brgy. Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao, is 55 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be Teresita's fifth loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Lotovale T. is 45 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  Lotovale has many years of experience in this business. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia C. is from the town of Panglao. She is 38 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a   fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish in the market. Delia has been engaged in fishing for over five years. Aside from fishing, she also started raising hogs a few years back and she hopes to acquire more piglets that she could raise.

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Delia is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Delia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.name: Aziz Mai's Group

texts.en:
Aziz mai lives in a city called Multan (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She does not know how to read or write but she is excellent in her embroidery art. She runs a boutique in her home. 

She has a big family and lives in a medium-sized home. She is the mother of three sons and two daughters. None of them could get their education due to financial constraints. Her eldest son is eighteen years old, and he works in a factory for a monthly wage. Her younger son also works in a factory for a low income. Aziz’s husband is a driver. He works full-time to put three meals a day on the table for his family. 

Aziz and her family lead a very simple life. Their expenses are very low, but they want to improve their standard of living. Aziz has applied for a loan from Asasah for the improvement of her boutique business. With the loan amount, she will buy clothes and embroidery material for making more quality products for selling through her boutique. She is a new loan user and hopes that it will be a good experience for her.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery material for boutique business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn U. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 35 years old, married, and has a 10-year-old child. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. She sells food, beverages, mobile phone credits, and furniture. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 12 years.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 23rd loan taken out by Jocelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and improve their house.

loans.name: Laila's Group

texts.en:
Laila Z. lives with her six family members in the historic city of Multan. She has two sons and two daughters, all of whom are in school. Laila has a business selling medicines.  Laila went to school through 10th Grade. She then got married and could not complete her education, but she wants to give her children the best possible education which is why she works. Her husband is a driver by profession. Both Laila and her husband work full-time to fulfill the basic needs of their family. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for the expansion of her medicine business. With the loan, she will buy medicines to sell in her shop.. She hopes that she will earn a good income by improving her store with additional medicines available for selling. She is a new loan user of Asasah. She hopes that she will enjoy increased profits with the help of the loan. 
Note: In this photo, her group member Nusrat Mai, is showing her embroidery business.

loans.use: To purchase medicines for reselling

To make a living, Panfila owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Panfila has been engaged in her business for over 10 years. She recently started cooking meals that she also sells to community members. 

Panfila joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Panfila has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Panfila is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house and pay her child's tuition fees.

loans.name: Munhchimeg

texts.en:
Munhchimeg S. is 24 years old and lives with her husband and son in Tuv province, central of Mongolia. She lives together with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her husband is a taxi driver who helps his wife's business while the son goes to a local kindergarten. 

Munhchimeg operates a food trading business out of a rented stall at a local market. She started her business in early 2010 after arriving from the countryside. She enjoys her work and for the future, Munhchimeg hopes to expand her business by offering a wider variety of products and purchasing a car with her business earnings as well. 

Her business is very important to her and her family, and she works very hard to improve their quality of life. She dreams of one day being able to build a small bakery. Munhchimeg is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more consumer products in order to expand her product line as well as buying bread-making equipment.

loans.use: To purchase more consumer products

loans.name: Shabnam Sultana's Group

texts.en:
Shabnam Sultana is a resident of the historic city  Multan, a very old city known for its tombs and hot weather. She lives in a three-room brick house with her family. Her family is very small as she is the mother of only one son who is not yet going to school. Shabnam can’t afford school fees but she wants him to get quality education. For that reason she works very hard. 

Her husband paints walls and houses to earn an income. He works with different companies on contract. Shabnam supports her husband financially by doing embroidery. She works for neighborhood clients but wants to expand her business.
 
Therefore, she has applied for a loan from Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan amount, Shubnam will be able to buy embroidery materials such as beads, cloth, and colored thread and will be able to finish larger orders on time which will help in sending her son to school. This is her first loan from any MFI and she is very much hopeful that her experience will prove successful and will continue into a long-term relationship with Asasah.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery materials to expand her business

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg B. is 25 years old and lives with her parents in Hovd province, a western of Mongolia.  She and her family live together in an apartment which her family has bought thanks to their business profits. Her father is retired and her mother manages a fruit business at the local market while her three younger sisters are students. 

Battsetseg operates a hair salon in a rented place at a local store. She started the hair  salon in 2009 and has progressed her business in a short time with many clients. Her daily sales and service revenues range from 30,000 to 70,000 MNT.  For the future, Battsetseg hopes to expand her business further.

Battsetseg works very hard and is a clever woman.  She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her salon.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her salon

loans.name: Buyanhuu

texts.en:
Buyanhuu H. is 54 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of Buyanhuu’s children are students while her husband works as a carpenter in their town. 

Buyanhuu operates a dairy product retail business in her town at the local market. She began her business in 1995 and attributes her business success to her knowledge of local market demands. She is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more dairy products to sell during the upcoming winter months when prices for such products traditionally rise.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products to sell

loans.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran lives with her family in a big city called Multan. Multan is very famous for its special foods, its sweetmeats, and also for its warm weather. She has a small family consisting of three persons Ameeran, her husband, and a son.

Her son has studied till 5th standard but couldn’t study further due to financial constraints. He is a very hardworking child. He has started helping his parents in their milk-selling business at a very early age. Now he fully supports them with getting milk from the buffalo. He is now twenty-one years old. He also helps them in taking care of the business. Presently, they have three buffaloes and he takes care of them to make sure they are giving high quality and good quantity milk. 

Ameeran's home is medium-sized and she has fixed up a small area for the cattle. She has applied for a loan for the first time from Asasah for her son. With the loan amount he will buy another buffalo and start his own milk-selling business. His mother is hopeful that he will be able to improve the family business by generating good income from it.

loans.use: Purchase a buffalo for her son's start-up dairy business

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina lives with her family in a big city called Multan. Multan is very famous for its special foods, its sweetmeats, and also for its warm weather. She lives in a small two-room brick  house in the area of Basti Khuda Daad. She does embroidery work for neighborhood clients while her husband works in a factory. 

Both works very hard to meet the basic needs of the family. Robina’s son is just one year of age. She wants to give him quality education; that’s why she wants to save some money for his bright future. She wants to improve her embroidery business and for this purpose she has applied for a loan from Asasah. With the help of a loan, she will buy embroidery materials such as cloth, beads and colored thread in bulk which will help her to make a larger quantity of embroidered dresses of good quality. 

She has been doing this business for the past five years and she knows very well about different fashion trends. She is very sure that she can succeed in her business by making an investment into it. 

This is the first time she has applied for a loan from any MFI and she is very much hopeful that this will prove successful for her business and will continue to a long-term relationship with Asasah.
