The ten members of the group "Benkadi I" are married women averaging 39 years of age and four children.  They live for the most part in polygamous families in Wobougou, a village in Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of being better able to organize their work when winter begins.  Their crops include rice, pearl millet, peanuts, and beans.  The group members are on their second farm loan.  The previous loan was repaid.  With the new loan, Ms. Alimata T., the group's president, intends to buy supplies and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 1.5 hectares of peanuts and beans.  After the harvests, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of consumers and retailers in the cities of Dioïla and Massigui.  The group members plan on making an average profit of about 70,000 francs CFA each planting season.  The women of this group put all their hope into the smooth progress of the winter planting effort. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plowing, seeds, manure, herbicides, weeding, and equipment

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa A. is currently in the business of selling books, boxes of pens and many other scholastic materials. She is requesting a loan to stock more exercise books and textbooks to sell.  Hawa is 39 years old. Her husband is a commissioner's secretary. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a supermarket.

loans.use: Stock more exercise books and textbooks to sell

loans.name: Erick Nyaribo

texts.en:
Eric is a businessman who runs a retail shop. He opened his shop in Naivasha town in January this year.  He is 26 years old, married to Peris Kemunto, and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and he has no history with any other micro-finance institutions. This will be his first loan.  He plans to add a stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour to sell.

In the future, Erick hopes he will be able to open up a wholesale store, still in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en: Samvel A. has been in the furniture business since December of 2002. He supports his immediate family and his elderly parents. Currently Samvel is making and selling furniture made to order. To increase his turnover, Samvel has applied for the loan aiming to purchase readymade furniture items.

loans.use: purchasing readymade furniture items

loans.name: Benkadi  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi II est constitué de  sept femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à Wobougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SALIMATA M. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,5 hectare d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.000FCFA environ par campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Benkadi II group is composed of seven married women having an average age of 36 years and 3 children each. Most live in polygamous families at Wobougou, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are, among others, rice, pearl millet, peanuts and beans. This is their second planting loan and the previous loan has been fully repaid. With this new loan, SALIMATA M. intends to pay for planting supplies, small tools and ploughing to maintain approximately 1.5 hectare of peanuts and beans. The crops are sold in the town of Massigui after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. They expect to make an average profit of around 65,000 CFA per planting.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ploughing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing and small tools

loans.name: Elizabeth Nyambura

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been in the motorcycle transportation business for over five years.  She normally employs people who operate the motorcycle on her behalf and bring in the cash at the end of the day.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her 1st loan.  She plans to buy a new set of tires for her motorcycle and service the motorcycle.

Elizabeth hopes to buy a taxi in the future which will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a new set of tires for her motorcycle and service the motorcycle.

loans.name: Benkadi  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Benkadi III sont des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Wobougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le riz, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MAÏMOUNA F. compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkadi III group are married women with an average age of 40 years and an average of four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Wobougou, a village in the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of Mali). They are working with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activities in the beginning of the rainy season. Their crops are rice, pearl millet, peanuts, and beans. They are on their second loan, and the previous loan was repaid in full. With this new loan, Maïmouna F. plans to buy fertilizers and small farming equipment and to pay for labor costs to maintain about 1 hectare of peanuts and beans. Their crops are sold in the city of Dioïla and in Massigui after harvest to a clientele of both men and women. They expect to make an average profit of about 40,000FCFA per planting season.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plowing costs, small farming equipment, and fertilizers

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza L.  is currently in the business of selling dresses and trousers at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bedsheets and also saddles to sell.  Tereza is 45 years old and is a widow.   She has 8 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: Stock bedsheets and saddles to sell

loans.name: Julias Ogola

texts.en:
Julias has operated his workshop in Naivasha town for the last ten years.  He is 33 years old, married to Jackline Agola, and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 3rd loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and on time.  He plans to buy more lumber for making new furniture to sell.

Julias plans to move his workshop near the town center in Naivasha, where he will get a place with electricity and increase his exposure to more clients.

loans.use: To buy more lumber

loans.name: Sophia  Achando

texts.en:
Sophia Achando is a small-scale businesswoman who sells secondhand clothes in an open air market. She has been in this business for four years, and is able to make a profit of $55 a month.The business is located in a strategic place where her customers can access the items easily.

Sophia is 36 years old, married, and blessed with four children. The first born is 14 years old, the second is 10, and the third and fourth are 5 and 3, respectively. The husband has a job and they work together to provide the basic needs of the family. She has no history with any other micro-finance institution. She is applying for her 2nd loan of 20,000 KES with KADET, after repaying her 1st loan successfully.   

She plans to purchase more materials to sell, with a desire to expand her business. With the income from the expanded business, she plans to improve the standard of living for her family, and she hopes to open her own shop where she will display the materials for sale.

loans.use: Buying more stock of materials

loans.name: Francis  Ndichu

texts.en:
Francis K. deals in various types of stationery and office supplies. His business is situated in the town center, and apart from the customers who can access his shop, he also supplies some paper goods to schools. He has been selling stationery for about eight years, and receives an income of about $1040 per month. His other source of income is farming.

This client has never borrowed from any other micro-finance institution, and was introduced to KADET by an existing client. This loan of 25,000 KES is his 1st loan with KADET. He plans to use the loan to expand his business and use the extra income to hire one more employee.

K. is 37 years old, married to Hellen Wacheke, and they are blessed with three children. He hopes to relocate to an industrial area where he would be able to get more customers. He is very hardworking .

loans.use: to expand the business and employ one more staff

loans.name: Bernard Onyonyi

texts.en:
Benard is a 38-year-old man. He owns a butcher shop where he sells meat to his customers. He has been in the business for a period of about four years  and he gets a profit of approximately of $685 per month.

He was introduced to KADET by his group members and he has applied for his 1st loan. He hopes to improve his business using the loans he receives from KADET. Currently his target is to use the money to buy a motorbike for transporting the meat.

He hopes to buy a piece of land in the future to build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transporting meat

loans.name: Albert Kyalo

texts.en:
Albert is a 34-year-old married man with two children. He owns a butchery as his primary business and also a retail shop. He has been selling meat for a period of about three years now. He has been getting a monthly profit of approximately $385 a month.

He was introduced to KADET by an existing client. He has applied for a loan which he wants to use to buy more stock of cereals like rice, and also beans and green grams (mung beans) for his retail shop. He hopes to improve his standard of living by buying a piece of land where he can build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans and green grams to sell in his retail shop

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan vive en casa de sus tíos en la zona el Rosario de la ciudad de la Paz; es soltero, no tiene hijos  y estudia contabilidad en el Instituto bancario, la actividad que realiza es la venta de artesanías en un puesto que tiene en el mercado Lanza  pero también  elabora carteras de tela de aguayo (tela de muchos colores).

El crédito que solicita será utilizado para la compra de más tela de aguayo y materias primas para sus artesanias.

Con Impro, es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito y por primera vez a través de Kiva, esta satisfecho con la tasa de interés, y el análisis de sus ingresos y gastos muestra que  puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the home of his aunt and uncle in the Rosario zone of the city of La Paz. He is single, has no children and studies accounting at the banking institute. He makes a living selling artisan crafts at a post he has in the Lanza market, and he also makes handbags out of multicolored cloth. He plans to use the loan he is requesting to purchase more multicolored cloth and other supplies for his crafts. This is his second loan with Impro and first via Kiva, and he is satisfied with the interest rate. An analysis of his income and expenses shows that he can be approved for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase multicolored cloth and other supplies to make artisan handbags

loans.name: Claudia Gabriela

texts.es: La Señora Gabriela  se dedica al servicio D. fotocopias desD. hace mas D. un año durante este periodo la señora indica que le fue bien en el negocio pero uno D. los costos mas elevados que tiene es el pago del alquiler del ambiente por esta razón  solicita  crédito para poder pagar un anticrético y desD. modo tener menos gastos, tiene una niña D. cinco años,  su esposo se encuentra en España quien regularmente le envía dinero para sus gastos, la señora anteriormente estuvo en España pero volvió por el tema D. salud D. su madre y decidió quedarse en el País pese a dejar un buen trabajo allá en España, pero no se arrepiente ya que su familia y la salud D. su Madre son  lo primero.
texts.en:
Gabriela has maD. a living providing photocopier services for more than year, during which time she says the business has gone well. However, one of her biggest expenses is paying to rent out her workspace, so she is requesting the loan so she can pay for the rental property and in this way have fewer expenses. She has a 5-year-old daughter, and her husband is working in Spain and regularly sends money to help her cover expenses. Gabriela previously was in Spain, but she returned because of her mother's health and decided to stay despite leaving a good job behind in Spain. But she has no regrets because her family and her mother's health are her first priority.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her rental space

loans.name: Elver

texts.es:
El señor Elver vive en la zona de ciudadela ferroviaria de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casado tiene tres hijos; la esposa trabaja en una institución que vende nichos. Elver tiene un auto con el cual trabaja como transporte libre con el cual genera sus ingresos, es cliente de Impro con 5 créditos a la fecha, todos cancelados y es primera vez que forma parte de Kiva a través de este nuevo crédito que solicita, el cual será destinado a la reparación y mantenimiento de su taxi.

Por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito nuevo.
texts.en:
Elver lives in the railway district of the city of La Paz. He is married and has three children. His wife works at a company that sells niche items. Elver has a car that he uses as a taxi to earn income. He has had five loans with Impro to date, all fully paid off, and this is his first time via Kiva. He plans to use the new loan he is requesting to make repairs and perform maintenance on his taxi. He qualifies to be approved for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make repairs and perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Martha Wangare

texts.en:
Martha Wangare is a businesswoman who has operated a retail shop in Naivasha town for over two years now.  She is 30 years old, married to Peter T., and they have five children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her 1st loan.  She plans to use the cash to buy retail goods to sell, including soap, sugar, rice and flour. Her main objective is to expand this business by ensuring that there is good stock available for her customers. 

Martha hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy retail goods to sell, including soap, sugar, rice and flour.

loans.name: Edward Ndambiri

texts.en:
Edward Ngare, a sole proprietor, is a businessman who has been providing laundry services for about ten years, with an income of about $20 a day. The business is situated at Shaurimoyo in Nairobi, where his customers are mostly the residents who gain from the laundry services. Edward is 52 years old, married to Susan, and they are blessed with four children.

He has no history with any other micro-finance institution. He is applying for his 3rd loan of 40,000 KES with KADET after repaying his previous loans successfully. With this loan, he plans to buy more detergents to expand his business, and also to employ one person to assist him in the laundry work.

Edward plans to grow his business, and plans to save the extra profit to buy a washing machine in the near future. He hopes to improve his standard of living. He is a very ambitious and hardworking man.

loans.use: Expand his laundry business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina vive en la ciudad de la paz; es viuda, tiene tres hijos pero todos son casados, vive sola y la actividad que tiene es la venta de carne de vaca y de cordero con esta actividad ella se mantiene y aunque ya es mayor de edad sigue muy activa, ya saco 5 créditos en Impro y fue parte de Kiva en una oportunidad; está satisfecha por la tasa de interés y los plazos otorgados.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de carne en mayor cantidad para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

Se sugiere dar otro crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Catalina lives in the city of La Paz. She has three children, but they are all married and she lives alone. Her business activity is the sale of beef and lamb. With this activity, she supports herself, and even though she is older, she continues being very active. She has already had five loans from Impro and one was a Kiva loan. She is satisfied with the interest rate and the terms offered. The loan that she is applying for is for the purchase of meat in larger quantities to satisfy the demands of her customers. It is suggested that she be given another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beef and lamb for subsequent sale to the public

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian vive en la casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, zona Río Seco. El es artesano y tiene su propio taller donde realiza fajas y correctores de espalda es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El no tiene hijos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de material de trabajo como tela, ligas y láminas de acero el cual le permitirá incrementar su mercadería.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Cristian lives with his parents and their home is located in the city of El Alto, in the Rio Seco district. He is a tailor and he has his own shop where he crafts skirts and back supports. This is his primary source of income. He does not have any children. This loan will be used to purchase material to work with, such as fabrics, elastics, and steel plates. It will permit him to increase his merchandise for sale. This is his first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase material to work with, such as fabrics, elastics, and steel plates

loans.name: Georgina Kalekye

texts.en:
Georgina is a 26-year-old lady. She has a retail shop where she sells general items such as maize flour, wheat flour, bread, margarine and toothpaste. She has been in the business for a period of ten years now, with a monthly profit of about $260 per month.

She wants to use her loan to add more stock of maize flour, wheat flour and bread. With her profit she hopes to increase her business to be a mini supermarket. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To add more stock of maize flour, wheat flour and bread

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban vive en la casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de el alto zona villa yunguyo de la ciudad de El Alto. El trabaja en el sindicato de transporte como chofer asalariado y esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El no tiene hijos, su familia esta compuesta por su mamá y Esteban. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción como cemento, estuco y ladrillo. Esto le servirá para refaccionar su cocina.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Esteban lives with his parents and their home is located in the city of El Atlo, in the Villa Yunguyo district. He works for the department of transport as a driver. This is his primary source of income. He does not have any children. His family is his Mom. This loan will be destined to purchase construction material, such as: cement, stucco, and bricks. He will be able to remodel his kitchen with these materials. This is his first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials to remodel a kitchen.

loans.name: G. S. Valle De La Zapata Nª 1 Group

texts.es: Este grupo Valle La Zapata N1 está formado por dos mujeres, A. tiene 46 años se dedica a la venta de ropa lo inicio como un trabajo para buscar una fuente de ingresos tiene 4 hijos y ayuda  a 2 de sus hijos para que salgan adelante. Ella invertirá el crédito en compra de materiales para poder crecer más en el negocio como pantalones, camisas, faldas, shorts y vestidos. Martha Lorena quien es otra de las miembros se dedica a la venta de artesanía, tiene 46 años sus hijos trabaja de manera independiente, y le ayudan en lo que más pueden, ambas son personas humildes y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. el financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
The group named Valle la Zapata N1 is made up of two women. A. is 46 years old and she sells clothing. She started the business when she sought a source of income. She has 4 children and she is helping two of them get a head start in life. She will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise to make her business grow, items such as: slacks, shirts, skirts, shorts, and dresses. Martha Lorena is the other member of the group and she sells crafts. She is 46 years old. Her children are independent but they help her as much as they can. Both of these individuals are humble people with a strong will to find success. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas vive en casa propia, su domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad del alto zona Bautista Saavedra. El trabaja en el colegio José Manuel Pando de la provincia pacajes como profesor normalista rural y su esposa vende dulces en el Colegio Walter Alpire. Estas dos actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso para la manutención de su familia y sus tres hijos,  
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción como cemento, estuco, ladrillo y calamina. Esto le servirá para construir un cuarto.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Tomas lives in his own home located in the city of El Alto, in the Buatista Saavedra district. He works in a school named Jose Manuel Pando, in the province of Pacajes. He is a civics teacher and his wife sells snacks and candies in the Walter Alpire school. These are the two sources of income contributing to the support of their family and their three children. This loan will be used to purchase construction material such as cement, stucco, bricks and aluminum sheets. This will help them build another room in their home. This is their first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials to build a new room in their house.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
Zonia vive en  casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de el Alto, zona Senkata. Ella trabaja como costurera y  es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Ella no tiene hijos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de 2 maquinas de costura el cual le permitirá crear su propio taller de costura.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Zonia lives with her parents and their home is located in the city of El Alto, in the Senkata district. She works as a seamstress and this is her primary source of income. She does not have any children. This loan will be used to purchase 2 sewing machines and this will permit her to set up her own tailoring shop. This is her first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchse two sewing machines to set up a tailoring shop.

loans.name: Leonardo Enrique

texts.es:
Leonardo de 37 años, el tiene un pequeño comedor en la entrada de su casa y vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil, (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas). 

Leonardo comenzó a vender afuera de su casa cebiches (plato común en las playas, contiene camarones) y encebollados (contiene cebollas y pescado). Poco a poco comenzó hacer comidas típicas hasta que pudo comprar mas mesas y sillas, ahora trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 14h30pm. 

Para poder agrandar mas su negocio el quiere comprar una cocina, y bebida para su negocio, en el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa ya que una parte esta construida de caña.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 37 years old and he has a small restaurant set up in the front part of his house. He lives in Fortin de Guayaquil (a suburban region equipped with dirt roads among the hills). Loenardo started selling cebiches (a common dish usually found along the coastal areas containing shrimp) and prepared fish dishes. With time he started to make more popular dishes. Eventually he was able to purchase tables and chairs, so now he works at home from 8:30 in the morning until 2:30 in the afternoon. So that he may expand his business he would like to purchase a stove and soft drinks. In the future he hopes to build a better home, where he lives now a section of the house if made of bamboo sticks.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a stove and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jenta

texts.en: Jenta Mkamburi is a 26-year-old secondhand clothing hawker, a mother of two children, and married to Johnson Mwafuwe, who owns a garage in Jomvu where they reside. She has been in this business for the past three years and intends to add more stock of secondhand clothes to sell and boost her business with the anticipated profit. Being her first loan with KADET, she hopes to be successful in her business and in her life.

loans.use: To buy more stock of secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Dante

texts.es:
Dante vive en la casa de su primo cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz, zona Achachicala. El trabaja en el sindicato de transporte Eduardo Avaroa como chofer socio propietario y esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención, tiene una hija.  
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de un motor para su vehiculo el cual le ayudara a trabajar mejorar.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Dante lives with his cousin and their home is located in the cit of La Paz, in the Achachicala district. He works for the transport company Eduardo Avaroa as a driver and part owner. This is his primary source of income. He has one daughter. This loan will be used to purchase a new engine for his car. This will improve the efficiency of his work. This is his first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for his bus.

loans.name: Medarda

texts.es:
La señora Medarda V. vive en casa propia en la zona de San Pedro  de esta ciudad, con sus dos hijos de 29 y 20 ambos están estudiando. La señora Medarda V. es jubilada percibe una renta mensual y es así como tiene los ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para pagar pensiones y compra de libros para su hijo ayudando de esta forma para que su hijo acabe sus estudios.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Medarda V. lives in her own home and it is located in the district of San Pedro. She lives with her two children, 29 and 20, and they are both attending school. Medarda V. is retired and she receives a monthly rent income, and it is the sole source of income for the household. The loan she is requesting is to pay tuition for her kids and purchase books so that they may complete their studies. This is her first loan and following a favorable socio-economic study she is qualified to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay tuition and purchase books for her son to attend university.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Felix Q. es casado, vive con la esposa y sus hijos de 12, 11, 10 y 4 años en alquiler en la zona de El alto de la alianza de la ciudad de El Alto.
El señor Felix Q. trabaja como chofer de taxi y la esposa se dedica a la venta de mercadería (ropa), es así como obtienen los ingresos para el hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un muro en el lote que compraron para luego hacer la construcción de una casa y así mejorar las condiciones de vida.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Felix Q. is married and he lives with his wife and their children, aged 12, 11, 10, and 4 years old. They rent their home in the city of El Alto, in the El Alto de la Alianza district. Felix is a taxi driver and his wife sells clothing and these are the two sources of income for the household. The loan requested is to build a wall in the piece of land they purchased. They hope to later complete building a house, and improve their way of life. This is his first loan and the favorable socio-economic analysis has granted him access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall on their land.

loans.name: Datitza

texts.es:
Datitza, vive en la zona de Alto Obrajes de la 
ciudad de La Paz.
Esta separada de su esposo  y tiene un hijo de 10 años que esta en la escuela en 5to básico.
Datitiza es secretaria en un bufete de abogados y también se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos.
Estudia en la universidad, y el dinero será destinado para la compra de una computadora. Es la primera vez que solicita el crédito y la primera que requiere el apoyo de kiva.
texts.en:
Datitza lives in the Alto Obrajes section of the city of La Paz. She is separated from her husband and has a 10-year-old son, who is in school. Datitza is a secretary at a law firm, and she sells perfumes and cosmetics on the side. She is also studying at the university, and the money from the loan will be used to buy a computer. This is the first time she has sought credit and the first time she has asked Kiva to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a computer that will help her in her work at university.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia N. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (orphans). She lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Olivia has a business selling bras at the market. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works six days out of every week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of bras.

The main business challenges for Olivia include seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand bras

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol vive en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; está separada del esposo y tiene cuatro hijos todos viven con ella incluyendo su mama, trabaja en Terrasur que es una Institución que vende casas y terrenos.

El crédito que solicita es para operar a su niña de 11 años a quien le descubrieron agua en los riñones, es cliente de Impro con tres créditos ya cancelados y es parte de Kiva por primera vez. Ella acudió a Impro por la tasa de interés y por las pocas garantías que se pide, esta satisfecha con el servicio.

Por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito nuevo.
texts.en:
Marisol lives in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. She is separated from her husband and has four children. They all live with her as well as her mother. She works in Terrasur, which is an institution that sells houses and land. The loan that she is asking for is for an operation on her 11 year old daughter; water was found in her kidneys. She has been an Impro client with three loans that she has already paid off and she is a part of Kiva for the first time. She went to Impro because of the interest rate and because they ask for few sureties. She is satisfied with the service. She can access this new loan because of the social nature of its use.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The cost of her 11 year old daughter's surgery, who was found to have water in her kidney.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El Señor Javier  se dedica al servicio de taxi ya hace dos años atrás obteniendo buenos resultados en sus ingresos diarios, siendo esta s u actividad principal se levanta muy temprano para iniciar su jornada de trabajo. Con este trabajo el puede ayudar a su familia en la alimentación de sus pequeñas hermanas, el solo mantiene el hogar ya que sus Papas no trabajan. En esta oportunidad el requiere el crédito es para cambiar el motor de su vehículo que ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo, es un joven trabajador y muy responsable, esta agradecido con la institución por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Javier has worked in a taxi service for two years and has obtained good daily income. This is his main activity and he gets up very early to begin his work day. With this job he is able to help family to feed his two little sisters. He is the household's only support since his parents don't work. At this time, he needs the loan to change his vehicle's engine, since it has finished its useful life. He is a hardworking and responsible young man and he is grateful with the institution for the opportunity it has offered.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an engine and other replacement parts

loans.name: Apu Salkantay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU SALKANTAY”; Los socios viven en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. María; ella tiene 61 años de edad y la socia es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos; la socia trabaja en la plazoleta de tricentenario, La socia trabaja desde hace 5 años vendiendo comida,  ella también vende huevo cocinado acompañado de papas cocidas y ají molido hecho a base de hierbas aromáticas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar los ingredientes para su negocio.
Los otros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, venta de granos secos (habas, maíz, maní, porotos, etc); compra y venta de madera; y otros socios como técnico en maquinarias pesadas, empleado en la región Inka, empleado en una agencia de viajes, docente de instituto, empleada de las hermanas de Calcuta. 

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su pequeño negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners are part of the Apu Salkantay community bank. The members live in the Santiago district in the province and department of Cusco. This partner is Maria. She is 61, and a single mother with 4 children. For the past 5 years this member has worked on the Plaza del Tricentenario selling food. She also sells eggs with potatoes and ground aji pepper with herbs. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her business. Other partners alternate their domestic responsibilities with activities such as, retail sales, grain sales (beans, corn, peanuts, green beans), and the purchase and sale of lumber. Other members include a heavy machine operator, an employee in the Inka region, a travel agent, a teacher, and and employee of the Calcutta sisterhood. This member appreciates the loan since it will allow her to grow her small business and have a better quality of life. She also commits herself to making her payments within the established time line.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member requests a loan to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Edison David

texts.es:
Edison de 41 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, el tiene una ferretería (lugar donde venden herramientas y materiales de construcción). 

El comenzó vendiendo herramienta a sus vecinos, poco a poco con ayuda de su esposa pudo surtir mas su pequeño puesto. Cuando agrando su negocio y surtió mas su mercadería pudo distribuir las herramientas a otras ferreterías. Ahora trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. 

El tiene dos hijos y como comenzaron la temporada escolar el quiere comprar con el préstamo libros y cuadernos para ellos y así darles una mejor educación. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de la ferretería.
texts.en:
Edison is 41 and lives in a urban area of the suburb of Guayaquil. He has a hardware store where he sells tools and construction materials. He started out selling tools to his neighbors and little by little with his wife's help he was was able to stock a small stand. When he expanded his business and increased his stock he was able to sell to other hardware stores. Now he works from 9:00 to 6:00 everyday. He has two children who have started school and wants to use the loan to buy their books and notebooks and so provide them with a better education. He would like to have more hardware store locations in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Books and notebooks

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
El señor Richard S. tiene 22 años se encuentra casado con la señora María del Carmen Almanza no cuentan con hijos, viven por la zona de Montenegro, a 23 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  una zona rural de la provincia Quillacollo del departamento de Cochabamba.

El señor Richard S. trabaja en su propia empresa como productor de material de construcción (yeso), y su esposa aun estudia y colabora en la comercialización de su producto, ambos esposos son personas muy dedicadas al trabajo. El Sr. S. se levanta muy temprano para el inicio de sus actividades durante el día, el horno para el quemado de la piedra caliza de la cual se extrae el material de construcción (yeso), lo tiene instalado en casa de sus señores padres, tiene ingresos mensuales que le permiten costear los gastos de alimentación y estudio. El Sr. Richard tiene las apiraciones de poder comprar su propia casa, o un terreno propio, por esa razon se esfuerza tanto.

El Sr. Richard S. solicita el presente crédito para el incremento de materia prima (piedra caliza), de esta manera aumentar la producción y así mejorar sus ingresos y en el futuro poder adquirir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Richard is 22 years old and married to Maria del Carmen. They don't have any children and live in the Montenegro area, a rural area located 23km from Cochabamba in the Quillacollo Province of the Cochabamba department. Richard has his own business manufacturing construction material (plaster). His wife is still in school and helps him sell his product. Both spouses are very hard working people. Richard wakes up very early to start his daily activities. The oven in which he burns limestone to extract plaster is located in his parents' home. He has a monthly income which allows him to pay for his food and schooling. Richard aspires to buy his own home or a lot of land and this is why he works hard. Richard requests the loan to purchase more raw materials (limestone) to increase his production and his income so that he can buy his house in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Todas Podemos Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su cuarto  ciclo es un comité ejemplar  ya que sigue unida y se encuentra trabajando arduamente cada una en sus actividades. 
Una de la señoras, de quien puede hablar es Cintia O. tiene  31 años, tiene 4  hijos, su actividad principal es la venta de comidas.
 Ella prepara comidas a personas que trabajan en fábricas u obras de construcción ofreciendo desayunos y almuerzos.
Así ella cada día obtiene ingreso para su familia y puede cubrir con algunos de la casa.
Ella es una señora muy  dedicada a sus hijos que hace de todo tipo de trabajo.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes como carne verduras, aceite, arroz y fideos.
texts.en:
This committee is currently in its 4th loan cycle. It is an exemplary committee in that it continues united and working hard at each of its activities. We can highlight one of the members: Cintia O., 31. She has 4 children and her main activity is food sales. She prepares breakfasts and lunches for employees of factories or construction sites thus earning income to cover some of her household expenses. She is a woman who is very dedicated to her children and does all kinds of jobs. She is asking for funds to buy ingredients like: meat, vegetables, cooking oil, rice and pasta.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, cooking oil, rice and pasta.

loans.name: Sueños De Cajón Group

texts.en:
This communal bank, “Sueños de Cajón” (The Draw of Dreams), consists of sixteen associates from the city of Temuco. These individuals’ livelihoods consists of sales including artistic manufactured and handcrafted wood pieces, the installation and maintenance of stoves, heaters, etc., and the sale of Avon cosmetic catalogue items, perfumes, firewood and coal, handcrafted steel structure items, eggs, cheeses and deli-store items.

William is the president of the group and, in the above photo, he can be found in the second row, first on the right right, wearing a red and black sport-jacket and holding Fondo Esperanza brochures in his hand.

William’s business consists of manufacturing cars (the structures of vehicles), and also masonry (construction, fences, sheds, etc.). He has two employees that he oversees and they assist him in this work. This has been his source of income and his profession for the past seven years; he took this as his calling after completing a program at a professional institute. He will use this loan to purchase a machine that can cut metal.

William’s dream is to have a professional mechanic’s shop, with all the machinery that he is still missing (which he notes is a lot). At this point he has a small space available by his house for his shop, and it’s slowly being adapted. William would also like to provide employment for more people and continue perfecting his profession.

William is grateful to Fondo Esperanza as it’s been the only place where he’s been able to obtain a loan as he has no credit history. That is to say, he has never had a credit card, which other financial institutions look at as a bad indicator, such that they neglect providing loans to those who seek to improve their business.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía Region. It is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lakeside spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community live, some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

loans.use: To buy a machine that can cut metal

loans.name: Nelly  Lucia

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 52 años de edad reside en el Municipio de San Jorge, departamento de San Miguel, es madre solteras, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 25, 16 y 14, ella tiene una venta de bebidas refrescantes.
El emprendió el negocio por iniciativa propia, tiene experiencia de 10 años en el negocio  y actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para compra de productos para elaborar comida, el compraría pollo, vegetales, especies, arroz, aceite que son necesario, esto contribuirá para generar ingresos, cubrir gastos y necesidades  básicas del familia.
Las aspiraciones de continuar con el negocio, generar ingresos que le permitan apoyar a los tres hijos para estudiar y sacar una carrera universitaria y generarles mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Nelly, 52, lives in San Jorge, San Miguel department. She’s a single mother of three children who are 25, 16 and 14 years of age. She sells refreshing beverages. She started her business by her own initiative and has 10 years experience. She is asking for funds to buy ingredients she needs to prepare her meals. She would buy chicken, vegetables, spices, rice and cooking oil which are necessary. This will help to generate income, cover costs and basic family needs. Her goals are to continue with the business, to generate income which will allow her to cover her children’s educational expenses in pursuit of a university education and provide improved living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken, vegetables, spices, rice, cooking oil.

loans.name: Agape Women Group

texts.en:
Kolu B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Agape Women. Kolu is 41 years old and is married with four children who range from 5 to 15 years old. She also cares for two siblings. Kolu was not able to attend school due to poverty.

For six years, Kolu has been selling bread in Congo Town Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,400 Liberian dollar portion of this 38,800 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of flour. She describes herself as a hard-working person.

Kolu’s goal is to expand her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of flour

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more lappas and dishes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic grains, cooking oil, toilet paper, Asistin (a brand of floor cleaning liquid), Natura's brand tomato sauce, coffee, sardines.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité  se dedican a variadas actividades entre las que se puede destacar  la venta de ropas, minutas , como empanadas , tortillas, croquetas ,asaditos de carne, reciclaje de cartón ,  también en la huerta.
 Actualmente este comité empieza el ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad  en las participaciones en las actividades y en las reuniones y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las que integrantes  además de la responsabilidad en los pagos. 
Desean que sus hijos no pasen por las mismas limitaciones laborales y educativas por eso se esfuerzan el doble para poder brindar a sus hijos oportunidades de progreso. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Elizabeth, quien se dedica a la peluquería que posee en su domicilio.
Desde muy joven se dedica a la esta profesión de mediante su esfuerzo consiguió instalar su peluquería con la comodidades necesarias para sus clientas.
Ella cuenta con muchas clientas, y actualmente quiere renovar algunas herramientas de trabajo por lo que solicita el crédito, como el secador, tipos de peines y cepillos para caballos.
texts.en:
The members of this committee work in a number of activities among them clothing sales, snacks such as empanadas, tortillas, savory pastries, carton recycling and vegetable gardening. The committee is starting a cycle in which it is highlighting responsibility within the business activities and meetings and aspirations each of the members have to better themselves. Also, it is highlighting responsibility for payments. They wish their children not to be limited in their work and education as they were. They work twice as hard to provide their children with better opportunities. Elizabeth is one of the members who has a hair salon in her house. She has been in this business since she was young. With her hard work she was able to build the salon with the comfort her clients need. She has many clients. She is requesting the loan because she wants to renew her working tools such as hairdryer, different types of combs and brushes.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hairdryer, hair combs and brushes

loans.name: Riverlee Sisters Group

texts.en:
Dekontee M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Riverlee Sisters. She is 40 years old, is married, and has five children who range from 3 to 23 years old.  She also cares for one sibling. Dekontee was only able to attend school through 5th grade due to lack of financial support.

For 20 years, Dekontee has been selling soft drinks on Broad Street, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 44,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more crates of soft drinks to sell.

Dekontee describes herself as an earnest woman. Her dream is to grow her business, build a house, and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: United People Group

texts.en:
Marie W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called United People. Marie is 40 years old, married and has five children who range from 10 to 24 years old.  She was not able to attend school due to poverty. She cares for one sibling.

For 15 years, she has been selling cooking oil, onions, pepper, rice, salt and beans in Congo Town Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 49,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cooking oil, onions, pepper, rice, salt and beans.  She describes herself as an earnest person.

Her dream is to grow her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, onions, pepper, rice, salt and beans

loans.name: Andriy

texts.en:
Andriy is single and owns a clothing sales business in his home town of Mukachevo. Andriy sells blouses, tops, skirts, jackets, purses and accessories in a store called "Scarlet". He inherited this business from his parents who started it as their family venture. Andriy has been running the store on his own for 3 years. Currently, he has 36,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory and his gross income is 18,000 Grivnyas.

Andriy is seeking a loan of 9,500 Grivnyas to refresh the assortment of merchandise he offers for sale in his store. His long term goal is the continued expansion of his business and increase in sales which will result in a stable income and improvement of living standards for Andriy himself and his family.

loans.use: to increase his turnover capital

loans.name: Janny Ondina

texts.es:
Janny de 42 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, ella es comerciantes informal de ropa y relojes de mano. 

Ella comenzó con su esposo a vender ropa deambulando en las calles del suburbio para poder mantener a sus dos hijos, poco a poco con esfuerzo alcanzo a comprar mas mercadería como relojes y mas ropa. Los dos trabajan desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. 

Para seguir con sus ventas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa para todo tipo de personas, en el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa, y tener un local de ropa.
texts.en:
Janny, 42, lives in an urbana rea of El Suburbio, Guayaquil. She is an informal clothing and wristwatch merchant. She started out in sales with her husband wandering throughout El Suburbio’s streets to be able to support their two children. Little by little with much effort she was able to buy more merchandise like wristwatches and more clothes. Both of them work from 8am until 7pm every day. To continue with sales she wants to use the loan to buy clothes for all types of people. In the future, she’d like to improve her house’s construction and have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina is a small market entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk. She started her children’s clothing / toy sales business 13 years ago. Katerina sells her retail products in one of the largest city markets. She has two vending locations and 2 hired employees. Her monthly income amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas. 

Katerina is married with 2 grown sons and a daughter. Family plays an important role in the life of Katerina. As a Mom, she often helps her children financially. She loves being self-employed and be able to help them out when she can. Katerina is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted children’s clothing and toys, i.e. 50 underpads, 50 onesies, 50 matinee coats, 50 pyjamas, as well as various toys for retail sale. One of Katerina’s goals is to generate sufficient income and finish construction of a house for her children who still live with her.

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn, lime powder and firewood.

loans.name: The Blessing Of God Family Group

texts.en:
Mardea B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called The Blessing Of God Family. Mardea is 35 years old, single and has two children, ages 7 to 12 years old. She was only able to attend School through 10th grade due to lack of financial support..

For 5 years, Mardea has been selling charcoal in Gaye Town Market, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 52,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She describes herself as an earnest woman.

Her dream is to grow her business, build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Kostya

texts.en:
Kostya is married and owns a transportation and car wash business in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. He offers transportation services in his locale.  Moreover, he has two hired employees who work at his car wash. The transportation business is very popular in this region of the Ukraine. The unemployment level is very high and people are forced to find different and innovative ways to feed their families. Kostya has been in this business for 7 years. His monthly income is about 5,000 Grivnyas. 

Kostya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to do major repairs to his car and repaint it. Eventually, Kostya hopes to purchase a newer and better vehicle for his business but can’t afford anything extravagant right now. The business is the main source of income for his family.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: On-Time Traders Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale-business people in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 500,000, they will each be able to add more stock to their business and make more sales and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living, send their children to school, and feed and clothe them.

Marie K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni about thirty-six years ago. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending schools.

Marie K. sells bars and packets of soap and has been running this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy soap making materials (palm-oil, caustic soda, etc.) in order to produce a large quantity of soap to sell.

loans.use: To buy more soap making materials like palm-oil, caustic soda, etc.

loans.name: By The Grace Of God Group

texts.en:
Asatu K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called By The Grace Of God. Asatu is 36 years old, married and has three children who range from 11 to 19 years old.  She was only able to attend School through 8th grade due to lack of financial support. For 8 years, Asatu has been selling banana in Larkpazee Market, Monrovia, Liberia.

Asatu plans to use her 16,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bananas. She describes herself as a determine woman. Her goal is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas.

loans.name: Señor De Accha Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. ACCHA”; Los socios viven en el distrito D. Accha en la provincia D. Calca y  departamento D. Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra Hilda; ella tiene 33 años D. edad y la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista; La socia  tiene solo primaria completa, ella se dedico desD. muy jovencita a trabajar junto a su madre y a cubrir las necesidades del hogar, siendo ella la hermana mayor, ayudo a sus hermanos para que pudieran tener día a día alimento y ropa, La socia trabaja hoy en día en el pueblo artesanal D. Pisac vendiendo comida para los artesanos D. la zona y aprendiendo hacer bisutería (aretes, collares, pulseras, brazaletes, llaveros)para tener un ingreso extra. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales, para elaborar la bisutería.

Los otros socios se dedican a la artesanía, internet, venta D. salchipapas, venta D. anticuchos, venta D. tortas, venta D. verduras, atención en emporio.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “SEÑOR D. ACCHA” communal bank. They live in Accha district, Calca province, Cusco department. Hilda, 33, lives with her live-in companion and they have 3 children. She alternates household chores with retail sales. She only finished elementary school. From a very early age she started working alongsiD. her mother in order to cover household expenses. Since she was the oldest sister, she helped her siblings to have food and clothing every day. Today, she works in Pisac, a town noted for its arts and crafts, selling food to the area artisans and learning how to make costume jewelry (earrings, necklaces, armbands, bracelets, key rings) in order to have an extra source of income. She is asking for funds to buy materials and supplies to make the jewelry. The other group members are in crafts, Internet services, salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausage) sales, anticuchos (grilled, skewered beef heart) sales, torta sales, vegetable sales and store management. Hilda values and is grateful for the granted loan because it will allow her to grow and have a better quality of life. She pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies to make costume jewelry.

loans.name: American Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “American” group, named after their most favorite country. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Mohamed K. (who is pictured in the left) is the leader of this group. The thirty-seven-year-old is single with four children. He has been a businessman for seven years now, owning a shop where he sells sardines, milk, sugar, lollipops, etc.

Mohamed will use his share of the loan to buy more of the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to his stock.

loans.use: To buy more sardines, milk, sugar, lollipops, etc., wholesale to add to his shop

loans.name: Mamlekat

texts.en:
Mamlekat T. is a 53-year old widow. She was born in a family of farmers and from early childhood had to help her parents in farming.   Mamlekat got married at the age of 20 and gave a birth to two sons. She moved to her husband’s home in Stepnoe village, where they lived with his elderly parents. Her husband worked on a  large state farm where Mamlekat got a job of dairymaid. He helped her in all her activities.  Later, they were able to buy a small house in Kara-Balta town (near the village). This couple worked hard to support their children. But in 1987, Mamlekat lost her support when an incurable disease caused her husband death. 

She became the only breadwinner for her family. Mamlekat, being courageous woman, remained firm in her wish to provide a good future for her children. Her salary didn’t cover all her family’s expenses, so she decided to start her own business.  In 1999, Mamlekat sold her house in the town and bought a dairy yard near her Stepnoe village. At that time, Mamlekat  had only several calves, later her livestock grew and she got milk cows.  Mamlekat’s family had revenues from selling their dairy products.  Today, Mamlekat has ten milk cows and ten bull-calves. Now Mamlekat requests a loan of 60,000 Kyrgyz Soms  to enlarge  the number of cows. It will allow her to further develop her business.

Two years ago, Mamlekat’s elder son married and moved out. Using the revenues, Mamlekat plans to help her younger son, who lives with her, to buy a house in Kara-Balta town. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Antony-Tamemsu Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Antony-Tamemsu” group. They are small-scale-business women based in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,200,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Rugiatu K. who is pictured on the left. She was born in Makeni and is age forty. She is married to a businessman and they have four children who are attending school.

For many years now, Rugiatu has been selling market food – rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), Margi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), onions, etc. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying more of the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more rice, palm-oil, Margi, onions, etc., to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Magbanie Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Magbanie” group. They are small-scale-business women based in Masorie, a village near Makeni city, northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Ya Bom Kaprr S.. The forty-year-old woman was born in Masorie village. She is married to a farmer and they have six children, one of whom is attending primary school, three are in secondary school and two are already grown-ups.

For many years now, Ya Bom has sold market food – rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), Margi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), onions, etc. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying more of the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more rice, palm-oil, Margi, onions, etc., to add to her stock

loans.name: Rahinatou

texts.fr: B. a appris la couture, après son apprentissage elle a ouvert son propre atelier dans lequel elle exerce son activité et ce depuis 2002. les gens aiment se faire confectionner des habits chez elle car elle est une bonne couturière. elle confectionne elle même des habits à partir des pagnes qu'elle vend à ses clients ou aux passants. elle veut acheter une  nouvelle machine à coudre pour remplacer l'ancienne machine, et aussi quelques pagnes pour confectionner de nouveaux habits raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit.
texts.en:
Ms. B. learned how to sew. After her apprenticeship, she opened her own workshop in which she has been operating her business since 2002. People like to have their clothing made at her place because she is a good seamstress. She makes the clothing herself using pagnes (colorful West African cloth) that she sells to her customers or to those passing by. Ms. B. wants to buy a new sewing machine to replace the old one. She would also like to buy a few pagnes for making new clothing. For these reasons, she is requesting an initial loan from WAGES.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a new sewing machine and some fabrics

loans.name: Lp/13962 Group

texts.en:
Thompson S., shown holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is Able. Thompson is 56, married, and has five children who are between the ages of 10 and 30 years old. He was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to financial difficulty. He cares for one sibling.

For eight years, Thompson has been selling rice, cooking oil, soap, milk, candles, mosquito spray and sugar in the Gbengba Town Community, Paynesville outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 8000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 36,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more of those products to sell.

Describing himself as a devoted family man, his dream is to improve his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, soap, milk, candles, mosquito spray and sugar

loans.name: Soap Sellers Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are the members of the “Soap Sellers” group. They are small-scale-business women based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Fatmata K.. She is age thirty-six and was born in Makeni. She is married with four children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending schools: one in primary school and three in secondary school.

For many years now, Fatmata has been selling soap. With her share of this loan, she will buy more soap-making materials (oil, caustic soda, etc.) in order to produce a larger quantity of soaps to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more soap-making materials such as oil, caustic soda, etc.

loans.name: Assana

texts.fr: F. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagne, elle a une ancienneté de plus de 10 ans dans ce commerce. plus tard elle a associé à cette activité le commerce de bijoux, elle s'approvisionne en pagnes au grand marché de Lomé et en bijoux au ghana voisin. la demande actuel de sa clientèle est élevée, pour les satisfaire elle a besoin d'un prêt pour s'approvisionner avec une vingtaine de pagnes de différentes qualités et quelques bijoux.
texts.en:
To generate income, Assana sells "pagnes" [traditional brightly-colored fabric]. She has been in this business for over 10 years. Later on, she combined this activity with the commerce of jewelry. She gets her supplies of pagnes at the general market in Lomé and her supplies of jewelry in neighboring Ghana. The current demand from her customers is high. In order to satisfy them, she needs a loan to stock up with twenty pagnes of various qualities and some jewelry.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pagnes

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: K. est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'agoè zongo. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la couture, elle détient son propre atelier de couture qu'elle a nommé "REGINA COUTURE", elle vend aussi des tissus que ses clients achètent pour faire confectionner après les habits. elle a des apprentis et les machines à coudre dont elle dispose deviennent insuffisant. elle souhaite acheter une nouvelle machine, elle sollicite donc de WAGES un prêt pour l'achat d'une nouvelle machine à coudre et de quelques tissus.
texts.en:
Yawa K. is a married woman and mother of two children. She lives with her family in the neighborhood of Agoè Zongo. She makes a living as a seamstress and has her own sewing studio named "REGINA COUTURE". She also sells fabrics, which her customers purchase to have clothes made. She has apprentices, but not enough sewing machines at her disposal. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to buy a new sewing machine and some fabrics.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
Lizbeth nació y vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo de la provincia del Cusco. A sus 23 años es una micro empresaria que se dedica a la venta de huevos de codorniz. Actualmente, Lizbeth cuenta con tres carretillas de venta de huevos de codorniz y tiene tres empleados quienes se encargan de vender en el mercado modelo de “Vino Canchón” del distrito de San Jerónimo y también se encarga de administrar la tienda de abarrotes, que está ubicado en su domicilio, donde vende comestibles a sus vecinos. Con su próximo préstamo, Lizbeth espera recibir $1100 USD. Le gustaría comprar dos carretillas más. 

El banco comunal “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo”, ya tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, pero Lizbeth tiene varios años participando  en el banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre del banco comunal es en homenaje al distrito de San Jerónimo y también porque viven por la zona.
texts.en:
Lisbeth was born in the San Jerónimo district of Cusco province. At the age of 23 she is a micro-entreprenuer dedicated to selling quail eggs. At present, Lisbeth can count on 3 push-carts to sell quail eggs and she has 3 employees in charge of sales in the “Vino Canchón” model market, located in the San Jerónimo district. She also has a grocery store which is located in her own house, where she sells foodstuff to her neighbors. With this next loan, Lizbeth hopes to receive $1,100 dollars. She wants to buy 2 more push-carts. The “Las Leonas de (Lady Lions of) San Jerónimo” Communal Bank has existed through 10 loan cycles, and Lisbeth has participated in this communal bank for various years. Things are going well. The bank's name pays homage to the San Jerónimo district and it also reflects the fact that they live there.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING TWO MORE PUSH-CARTS FOR SELLING QUAIL EGGS

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 72 años y vive con su esposo en la ciudad del Cusco y fruto de esta unión tienen cuatro hijos. Doris  se dedica a la elaboración de chocolates y artesanía y solo vende a sus familiares, amigos y hermanos. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Con su próximo préstamo, Doris espera recibir $150 USD. Le gustaría comprar insumos y materiales para elaborar los chocolates.

El banco comunal “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo”  ya tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, pero Doris tiene 3 años participando  en el banco comunal y le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Doris, 72, lives with her husband in the city of Cusco; they have four children. Doris makes chocolates and crafts that she sells to her family members, friends and brothers. She has been in this business for several years now and does quite well thanks to the efforts she puts into it. She expects to get $150 USD in her next loan. She would like to buy ingredients and supplies to make the chocolates. The “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo” (Lionesses of San Jerónimo) communal bank has been in operation for 10 cycles but Doris has been participating for 3 years and does very well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies to make chocolates.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 50  años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo Martin. ellos se casaron y fruto de esta unión tienen cuatro hijos. Gregorio tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado "Molino", donde vende productos secos como por ejemplo trigo, maíz, cebada, moraya y chuño. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Le pueden encontrare en su puesto de venta, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 6 la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.   
 
Con su próximo préstamo, Gregoria espera recibir $700 USD. Le gustaría viajar a la ciudad de Paucartambo para comprar maíz.

El banco comunal “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo”  ya tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, pero Gregoria hace varios años atrás que recién participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Gregoria, 50, lives in the city of Cusco with her husband, Martin. They have four children. Gregoria has a stand in the “Molino” Market where she sells such dry goods like: wheat, corn, barley, moraya and chuño (potato varieties). She has been in this business for 15 years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She can be found tending to her stand seven days a week from 6am until 6pm. Gregoria expects to get $700 USD in her next loan. She would like to travel to the city of Paucartambo to buy corn. The “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo” (Lionesses of San Jerónimo) communal bank has been in operation for 10 cycles but Gregoria has been participating for several years now and does very well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia tiene 79 años y vive con su esposa en la ciudad del Cusco y tienen seis hijos. Amalia antes vendía carne en el mercado “Vino Canchón” pero desD. que su esposo sufrió un accidente tuvo que dejar D. trabajar para que pueda atender a su esposo que se quedo inválido.

Decidida a continuar su vida,  Amalia se las ingenia para vender caldos los días domingos en el mercado “Vino Canchón”, donD. la pueden encontrar, desD. las 6 mañana hasta el medio día o hasta que se agote los caldos, ella venD. varios tipos D. caldos como por ejemplo caldo D. cabeza D. res, caldo D. patas y caldo D. panza. Ya son 20 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.
 
Con su próximo préstamo, Amalia espera recibir $200 USD. Es para el gasto familiar y para la salud D. su esposo que esta invalido. 

El banco comunal “Las Leonas D. San Jerónimo”  ya tiene 10 ciclos D. funcionamiento, pero Amalia hace varios años atrás que recién participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Amalia, 79, lives with her husband in the city of Cusco; they have 6 children. Amalia used to sell meat in “Vino Canchón” Market but since her husband suffered an accident which left him an invalid she had to stop working in order to stay home to care for him. Determined to continue her life, Amalia figured out a way to sell soups on Sundays in “Vino Canchón” Market. She can be found there from 6am until midday or until she runs out of soups. She sells a variety of soups like: beef head soup, foot soup and stomach soup. She has been doing this for 20 years and does quite well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Amalia expects to get $200 USD in her next loan which is to cover family expenses and for her invalid husband’s care. The “Las Leonas D. San Jerónimo” (Lionesses of San Jerónimo) communal bank has been in operation for 10 loan cycles. Amalia has been participating in the bank for several years and does quite well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For family expenses and for care of her invalid husband.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín tiene 36 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Valentín trabaja en el gobierno regional del Cusco desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. Valentin se levanta muy temprano para vender jora de maíz a su clientes. Ya son 9 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.
 
Con su próximo préstamo, Valentín espera recibir $800 USD. Por el momento, tiene suficiente mercadería en su domicilio. Le gustaría con el dinero del préstamo para comprar maíz. 

El banco comunal “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo”  ya tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, pero Valentín hace varios años atrás que recién participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Valentín is 36 years old and lives in the city of Cusco with his wife and two children. He works for the regional government of Cusco from seven in the morning until three in the afternoon. He rises very early to sell "jora de maiz" (corn meal derived from germinated seeds) to his customers. He has been selling "jora de maiz" for 9 years and has been successful due to his determination and effort. With this loan application, Valentín hopes to receive $800. At the moment, he has sufficient merchandise in his home. He would like to buy corn with the loan proceeds. The communal bank “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo” (The Lions of San Jerónimo) has already completed 10 loan cycles, but Valentín only joined the bank several years ago. He has been a productive member.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn.

loans.name: G.s. Los Cocos Group

texts.es: Maria Isidora, Eulalia Ines, Cristina de la Concepción, Rosario y Ángela conforman el grupo solidario Los Cocos. Este no es el primer financiamiento que realizan juntas.  Eulalia se dedica a la venta de frijoles,  ella tiene 44 años, inicio hace 4 años con la venta de tortillas pero con las mismas ganancias que obtenía fue que se decide establecer la venta de frijoles, Rosario se dedica a la venta de leche y leña, Ángela a un taller de costura Maria Isidora que también se dedica a la venta de leche y Cristina se dedica a un taller de costura. Ellas son personas muy independientes, ya que siempre han demostrado ser muy responsables. El financiamiento que solicitan es para la compra de materia prima necesaria para sus negocios.
texts.en:
Maria Isidora, Eulalia Ines, Cristina de la Concepción, Rosario y Ángela are members of the communal bank "Los Cocos" (The Coconuts). This is not their first loan application. Eulalia sells beans.
