Yvon  tiene un negocio D. ferretería  “DISTRIBUIDORA ALZA”  en este negocio trabaja junto a su esposo  por mas D. 15 años, alquilan un local donD. tienen mucha clientela  ella por su parte se dedica a las ventas y compras  D. los materiales que venden,  por otro lado están incursionando en la fabricación D. transformaciones D. tuberías D. plástico algo que no hay mucho en el mercado  este producto lo ofrecen  a otras ferreterías  que les hacen pedidos y tienen mucha demanda , su trabajo  le da muchas satisfacciones ya que pueD. brindarle a sus hijas una buena educación  en la universidad  y poder vivir cómodamente. lo que quiere lograr muy pronto  es  poder comprar el local donD. tiene su negocio  para dejar D. pagar alquiler y así mantener su clientela , la Sra. Yvon es la secretaria  D. la alcancía “SOLIDARIDAD”  con su préstamo comprara mas productos para su ferretería como tubos,alambres,cemento,fierros etc. D. esta manera poder ofrecer variedad a su clientela. 

* La Sra. Yvon es la 6ta D. la derecha tiene chompa roja y anteojos.
texts.en:
Yvon runs a hardware store named Alza Distributions. She has been working alongsiD. her husband for the past 15 years. They rent the space for their store but the clientele is very good at that location. She takes care of buying and selling all the merchandise. They have also started manufacturing plastic tubing. This type of service is not very common and they offer this special service to other hardware stores since there is such high demand. Her work brings her a great deal of personal satisfaction because she can send her daughters to university and they can live comfortably. She would very much like to purchase a space to run the store so that they won't have to rent anymore. Yvon is the secretary of the community bank named Solidarity. With the help of this loan she will purchase more inventory for the hardware store, such as: tubing, wire, cement, steel bars etc. She wants to add greater variety to the products she offers her clientele. *Yvon is the 6th person on the right, wearing the black sweater and glasses.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for hardware store.

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José Carlos es un padre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el sector Las Adelinas del distrito de Cayaltí, un distrito agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace mas de diez años, el cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en el cual suele sembrar arroz, debido a la abundancia de agua para regadíos en la zona, se suele sembrar este cultivo dos veces por año, a diferencia de otras zonas de la región en las cuales se siembra solo una vez. Este cereal es bastante consumido en el país por lo que su cultivo es bastante importante en la alimentacion de las familias peruanas.

José Carlos depende de esta actividad para solventar los gastos de su familia por lo que siempre trata de entregar lo mejor de si para sacar a su cultivo adelante. Actualmente desea adquirir algunos insumos como fertilizantes y pesticidas que le permitan lograr su ojetivo, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

José Carlos es una persona trabajadora y entregada a su familia, en la zona donde vive el es conocido por ser alguien honesto y de confianza. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Jose Carlos is a family man, 46 years old, and he lives together with his wife and their two children in the Las Adelinas district. This region is primarily agricultural land located about one hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked as an agriculturist for more than 10 years. He owns a piece of farm land where he sows rice given the large quantities of water available for irrigation in the region. He sows seeds twice per year, different from other regions where they can only sow once a year. This cereal is a staple food in the country so it is an important part of the Peruvian diet. Joan Carlos depends on this occupation to cover the family expenses. He always tries to do his best with his plantations. He is currently in need of some materials such as fertilizers and pesticides. These materials will help him meet his goals. For this reason he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. Jose Carlos is a very hard working person and he is devoted to his family. In the region where they live he is well known for being an honest, trustworthy person. Previously he has worked with this organization and he has always been responsible with his obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides for the rice plantation.

loans.name: Laura Azucena

texts.es:
La Señora Laura Azucena V. es socia del banco comunal Cumbe, vive en la comunidad de San Antonio que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es conocida por su exuberante vegetación, es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, mucha de su población joven a migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.

Doña Laura Azucena tiene 33 años es casada  y tiene 5 hijo de 17, 15, 14, 11 y 9 años de edad, sus cuatro primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultima hija estudia en una escuelita de la comunidad, su esposo trabaja como albañil, tiene casa propia que le fue heredada por sus padres, pero su hermano hipoteco la casa para poder salir del país hacia los Estados Unidos, lamentablemente el no cancelo la deuda por lo que su casa ahora se encuentra en remate.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de chanchos y cuyes los cuales los vende en su comunidad cuando tiene  alguna necesidad, también  lava ropa  y arregla  casas pero este no es un trabajo fijo.

Es socia del banquito hace 6 años, los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su negocio y en el estudio de sus hijos, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos. Su meta es darles a sus hijos la mejor educación para que se superen en la vida.
texts.en:
Laura Azucena V. is a member of the community bank named Cumbe. She lives in the community of San Antonio, a community that is part of the Cumbe region. This region is well known for its exuberant vegetation. The climate is relatively cold and the population is mostly made up of cattle farmers and agriculturists. Many of the young members of the population have emigrated in search of better work opportunities. Laura Azucena is 33 years old, she is married and she has 5 children, aged 17, 15, 14, 11 and 9. The four eldest children are in school and her youngest daughter goes to primary school in the community. Her husband is a construction worker. They have their own home because it was inherited from her parents. But her brother mortgaged the house to move to the United States. Unfortunately he never paid back the loan so their house is currently in foreclosure. Laura Azucena's occupation is raising pigs and guinea pigs. She sells them in the community and whenever she has a special requirement she washes clothes and cleans houses, but this is not a regular job. She has been a member of the community bank for the past 6 years and she has received a great deal of support in the development of her business, and in turn she has been able to send her kids to school. This loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs. Her goal is to give her kids a better education so that they may succeed in life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Damas Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Zoila es químico farmacéutico desD. muy jovencita trabajo en diferentes  farmacias  pero  siempre tenia en mente tener la suya propia, para no seguir trabajando para otros, gracias a la ayuda D. su esposo y unos ahorros que tenían en comun lo pudo lograr, empezó con muy poca mercaderia solo algunas medicinas lo esencial. gracias a sus conocimientos en farmacia gano clientes ya que la atencion era mas personalizada en la actualidad  su botica ha crecido mucho tiene variedad D. productos para ofrecer a su clientela, ahora esta pensando en poner otra sucursal D. su botica pero en provincia es algo que espera concretar muy pronto su mayor logro es tener  su botica bien surtida y poder vivir junto a su familia cómodamente, con su présT. quiere seguir  invirtiendo en la compra D. medicinas y perfumeria , “DAMAS TRIUNFADORAS” es el grupo al cual pertenece  donD. es la tesorera cargo que desempeña con mucha responsabilidad.

 * Zoila es la 5ta D. la foto esta sentada con casaca negra.
texts.en:
Zoila is a pharmacist. Since she was very young she has always worked in a pharmacy. She has always had the dream of having her own pharmacy so that she would not have to work for others any more. Thanks to her husband's help and with some savings she has been able to manage her dream. She started with only a modest inventory, only a few medicines, only the bare essentials. With her knowledge of pharmacy she has gained a good deal of clients and because her service is personalized her pharmacy has grown significantly, offering a large variety of products. She is now thinking about putting up another pharmacy at a different location. Her greatest dream is to have her pharmacy well stocked and to live with her family comfortably. This loan will be used to acquire more inventory, to purchase more medicines and perfumes. Triumphant Women is the name of the community group to which she belongs. She is the treasurer of the group, a position of great responsibility. *Zoila is the 5th person in this photo, seated wearing a black sweater.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase medicines for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Juntas Si Podemos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Juntas si Podemos inicia su ciclo 6, las socias son de la Provincia de Huanta y realizan diferentes negocios.
Como es el caso de la Señora Alejandra que es casada y tiene 8 hijos que son estudiantes, Alejandra tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, sus productos los adquiere en algunas oportunidades de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Alejandra se dedica a la compra de tara, cochinilla y lúcuma, pues la región donde vive es productora de estos productos, luego los comercializa a intermediarios, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de tara, cochinilla.
Los sueños de Alejandra son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The community bank named Together We Can has started its 6th loan cycle. The members are originally from the Huanta province and they all carry out different types of businesses. Alejandra is married and she is the mother of 8 children, all are attending school. Alejandra runs a grocery stO. from her home. She acquires her products from other businesses in the city of Ayacucho. Alejandra is also buys and sells tare, cochineal and lucuma fruit. The region where they live is a large producer of these products. She sells them to retail stores. This loan will be invested in the purchase of tare and cochineal. Alejandra's dream is to see her children complete their schooling and see them in their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tare and cochineal.

loans.name: Rosa Florinda

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa Florinda Gualtamber es socia del banco comunal Cumbe, vive en el centro de la parroquia Cumbe, esta parroquia es conocida por su exuberante vegetación, es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, mucha de su población joven a migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.
 
La Señora. Rosa Florinda tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos  de 27, 24 y 12 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas son solteras y trabajan para sus gastos y su último hijo este año ingresa al colegio, su esposo trabaja como albañil pero como no hay mucho trabajo ahora esta dedicado a la ganadería, con el esfuerzo y el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica al negocio de animales, vende ganado, borregos y chanchos, trabaja todos los días y los fines de semana se dedican a  su restaurante en donde prepara una gran variedad de platos  especialmente con carne de chancho.

Es nuestra socia hace 3 años atrás pero se ha retirado un tiempo del banco comunal, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, le gusta mucho la banca comunal por que se encuentra con sus amigas, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ganado, su meta es crecer en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Rosa Florinda Gualtamber is a member of the community bank named Cumbe. She lives in the centre core of the Cumbe region. This region is well known for its exuberant vegetation and its cold climate. The population is mostly made up of cattle farmers and agriculturists. Much of the younger population has emigrated in search of better job opportunities. Rosa Florinda is 47 years old, she is married and she has 3 children, aged 27, 24 and 12 years old. The eldest two daughters are single and are financially independent. Her youngest son starts school this year. Her husband works as a construction worker but because there isn't very much work he is also a cattle farmer. With their mutual hard work they were able to build their own house. Rosa Florinda raises livestock, sells cattle, sheep and pigs. At this occupation she works on the weekdays but on the weekends she runs their restaurant where they serve a lengthy menu, especially using pork meat. She has been a member of the community bank for 3 years, though she took a leave of absence. She is on her second loan cycle. She very much enjoys working with the community bank because she gets to collaborate with her friends. The loan will be invested in the purchase of more livestock. Her goal is to make her businesses grow.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Patty Lorenza

texts.es:
Patty es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, un distrito agrícola caracterizado por presentar una geografía accidentada, dada su cercanía a la sierra del país, en encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la preparación y venta de alimentos, ella vende salchipollo (plato originario del país consistente en pollo frito con papas fritas y salchichas) por las tardes en una carreta especialmente acondicionada para realizar esta acción. Este negocio es una fuente muy importante de ingresos para su familia ya que con ellos ayuda a su esposo, que trabaja como albañil, con los gastos familiares.

Patty desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas insumos de modo que pueda preparar mas platos y así percibir mayores ingresos con su venta , para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Patty tiene como meta seguir trabajando hasta poder tener un restaurante, en la zona donde vive las personas que la conocen la consideran una mujer tranquila, trabajadora y entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
Patty is a Mom and she is 32 years of age. She lives together with her husband and their two children in the district of Nueva Arica. This is an agricultural region with a mountainous geography, given their proximity to the country's mountain ranges. This village is located about 90 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 5 years she has been selling prepared foods. She sells 'salchipollo'. It is a popular national dish of fried chicken, friend potatoes, and sausages. She sells the food in the afternoons along a very well traveled road, a road especially managed for this type of business. Her business is a very important source of income for their family. She is able to contribute to the household expenses with her husband who works as a construction worker. Patty wishes to expand her business and to purchase more ingredients and more plates, so that she will see an increase in her sales. To reach her goal she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles. Patty's goal is to keep working until she is able to set up a restaurant. In the region where she is known to be a decent, hard working woman who is dedicated to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Olga Zulema

texts.es:
la sra. Olga Zulema M. vive Nacaome Valle, se dedica a la compra y venta de zapatos para dama y caballeros, tiene mas de tres años de experiencia en este tipo negocio, sus ventas son de lunes a sabado en el interior del mercado y los domingos ventas ambulantes estas las realiza en barrios y colonias de Nacaome y Goascoran.
 
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de zapatos.
Olga es una persona muy emprendedora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante.
su mayor deseo es que sus gemelos crescan sanos.
texts.en:
Olga Zulema M. lives in the Nacaome Valley. She buys and sells ladies' and gentlemen's shoes. She has more than three years in the field. She carries out her sales from Monday to Saturday in the market and on Sundays she sells door to door in the various districts and colonies of the Nacaome and Gaoscoran regions. The loan will be invested in the purchase of shoes. Olga is a very hard working person with a great appetite for success. Her greatest wish is to see her twin boys grow up healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Mitapasamanan Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Mitapasamanan inicia su tercer ciclo con 13 socias que son de la comunidad de Mitapasamanan, Distrito de Vinchos, se encuentra a 50 kilómetros de la ciudad de Ayacucho, la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.
La señora Julia es la fiscal del Banco Comunal, Julia es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Julia se dedica a la compra de quesos en su comunidad y otros pueblos aledaños, sus ventas en la ciudad de Lima y Ayacucho, al inicio solo vendía en la feria de su Distrito, poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo, Julia tiene proyectado dedicarse a la ganadería para producir leche, con su préstamo tiene proyectado comprar una vaca lechera.
Julia sueña con educar a sus hijos y tener una casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
The community bank named Santa Rosa de Mitapasamanan has started their third loan cycle. All 13 members are from the Mitapasamanan community in the Vinchos district, located 50 kilometers from the city of Ayacucho. The population is mostly made up of agriculturists and cattle farmers. Julia is the treasurer of the community bank. She lives together with her husband and their 4 children, all of whom are attending school. Julia sells cheeses in the community and in other neighboring cities, Lima and Ayacucho. She started out selling only in the fairs of the region but her business started to grow. Julia wants to dedicate her time to dairy farming. This loan will be used in the purchase of a dairy cow. Julia dreams of keeping her kids in school and to one day have a house in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a diary cow.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una madre D. familia D. 40 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos en el distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola caracterizado por dedicarse  a la producción D. frutas, las cuales son procesadas para ser exportadas a diversos países. La zona pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desD. que era joven a la crianza y venta D. animales menores, ella cría ovejas en unos corrales situados cerca a su vivienda, cuendo sus ovejas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes del lugar. Este negocio le permite obtener algunos ingresos con los que ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos familiares.

Victoria desea mejorar la alimentación D. sus animales para poder lograr que se desarrollen D. mejor manera y percibir mayores ingresos al momento D. venderlos, para lograr su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 800 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra D. alimento balanceado.

Victoria es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir ayudando a su esposo para poder mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia. En la zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran alguien D. confianza.
texts.en:
Victoria is 40 years old and a Mom and she lives together with her husband and their five children in the district of TambogranD., a primarily agricultural region mostly known for its production of various fruit. The regional products are exported to various countries. This region is located in the province of Piura and it is more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital cit of Lambayeque. She was young she has always raised and sold livestock. She raises sheep in corrals located near her home. When her sheep have matured enough she sells them to her neighbors and businesses in the region. This business grants her an income with which she contributes to the household expenses. Her husband is an agriculturist. Victoria wishes to upgraD. the feed she uses for her sheep so that they will grow better, and they will give her better returns. To reach her goal she is requesting a first loan in the amount of 800 nuevos soles to Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). The funds will be invested in the purchase of high quality feed. Victoria is a very hard working person and she is devoted to her family. Her greatest wish is to keep working with her husband to improve the quality of life for their family. In her neighborhood she is very well liked and she is known to be trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase high quality feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Medical expenses.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad.
Felicitas es casada y tiene 5 hijos que estudian, Felicitas se dedica a la venta de frutas en las diferentes ferias de la región, a donde viaja 2 veces por semana y de las ferias compra maíz, queso, productos que luego comercializa de casa en casa, en un inicio vendía también frutas pero en menor cantidad y de manera ambulatoria, ahora su negocio ha crecido.
Felicitas solicita un crédito de 1000 soles para la compra de manzanas, plátanos.
Felicitas sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the community bank named Dignity. Felicitas is married and she has 5 children, all of whom are attending school. Felicitas sells fruits in various fairs in the region. She travels twice per week to purchase corn and cheese, products that later she resells door to door. At first she only sold fruit but now her business has grown. Felicitas requests a loan in the amount of 1000 soles to purchase apples and bananas. Felicitas dreams to see her kids in a career.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase apples and bananas.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos esta en primer grado y el otro es bebe, Marleny junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de sombreros, brindan este servicio a diferentes tiendas de sombreros, actividad que realiza con ayuda de trabajadores dependiendo de la demanda del producto, también Marleny lleva los sombreros a las ferias para incrementar sus ventas.
Marleny es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad y solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de materia prima.
Marleny sueña con tener una tienda de sombreros y tener casa propia pues vive en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Marleny lives together with her husband and 2 children. One of them is in first grade and the other one is a baby. Marleny, together with her husband, makes sombreros. They sell their product to different stores. She has some hired help to carry out the manufacturing depending on the demand. Marleny also sells the sombreros at different fairs to supplement her sales. Marleny is a member of the community bank named Dignity. She requests a loan in the amount of 1000 soles to purchase materials. Marleny dreams of opening her own sombrero store and she dreams of having her own house. Currently they live with her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make sombreros.

loans.name: Hilda Senayda

texts.es:
la sra. Hilda Senayda M. L. tiene 57 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Rafael L. quien se dedica 
a la compra venta de ganado, maiz, sal etc. 
Tienen tres hijos que dependen de ellos.
doña Hilda muy dedicada a su familia y a su negocio que es la venta de lacteos al por mayor
y al detalle, sus ventas son diarias.el credito lo utilizara para comprar queso oriado, queso seco, queso semiseco, queso ahumado, quesillo, requeson, mantequilla.
 
su mayor deseo es que sus ventas sean mejores cada dia para a si tener mejores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Hilda Senayda M. L. is 57 years old. She is married with Rafael L., a merchant of cattle, corn and salt. They have three children and they are all still dependent on them. Hilda is very dedicated to her family and to her business. She sells dairy products in wholesale and retail. She carries out her sales daily. The loan will be used to purchase cheese, and butter. Her greatest wish is to see an improvement in her sales and have better earnings. She will use these earnings to cover the household expenses and to care for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheeses and butter.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
Aidee es casada y tiene 2 hijos que ya terminaron la universidad y están en el proceso de titilarse en su carrera profesional. Aidee tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Aidee tiene un taller de confecciones, que se encuentra en el mismo lugar.
Aidee es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad y solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de cuadernos y gas.
Aidee sueña con tener un taller de confección mas grande y que sus hijos tengan una notaria.
texts.en:
Aidee is married and she has 2 children, they have both graduated from university and they are about to receive their degrees. Aidee has a store in a section of her house where she sells general grocery store items including vegetables and meats. She carries out her business every day with the help of her children. Aidee also has a supply store in the same locale. Aidee is a member of the community bank named Dignity. She requests a loan in the amount of 2000 soles to purchase notebooks and natural gas. Aidee dreams of having a larger supply store and to see her kids start a notary.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase notebooks and natural gas.

loans.name: Lourdes Roxana

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su padre y a su madre en el caserío Colera,una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona caracterizada por producir frutas de exportación, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, ella cría aves de corral al aire libre, cerca a su vivienda, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes del lugar. Este negocio le permite obtener algunos ingresos con los que ayuda a sus padres con los gastos familiares.

Lourdes desea mejorar la alimentación de sus aves para lograr que se desarrollen de mejor manera y percibir mayores ingresos al momento de venderlas, para lograr su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos con los cuales comprará alimento balanceado.

Lourdes es una joven responsable y trabajadora, su anhelo es seguir apoyando a sus padres y contribuir al mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una joven tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 26 years old, she is single and she lives with her father and her mother in the community of Colera, in the primarily agricultural region of Tambogrande. This region is known for the export of local fruit products, and it is located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo. She raises and sells turkeys and chickens in a free-range corral close to her home. Once the livestock have reached a certain size she sells them to her neighbors and to businesses in the region. This business grants her a source of income and she is able to help her parents with the family's expenses. Lourdes wants to upgrade the quality of the feed she uses to that they will develop better and get better prices when they are sold. To reach her goal she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for the first time, requesting a loan in the amount of 500 soles to purchase high quality feed. Lourdes is a very hard working and responsible young woman. Her dream is to keep helping her parents in continuing to contribute to the improvement of the family's quality of life. In the neighborhood Lourdes is known as a decent and trustworthy young woman.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase high quality feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials to change the roof on her house, to plaster some walls in her house, and for various personel expenses

loans.name: Lita's Group

texts.en:
Lita S., from the village of Bayabay Panalsalan Plaridel Misamis Occidental, is the 19-year-old group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Bayabas.

Lita, a married mother of an infant, owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP.

In 2009, Lita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to invest in expanding the business, she is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Lita's second from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima B., from the village of Unidos Plaridel Misamis Occidental, is 60 years old and married. To make a living, Maxima owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and candies in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Maxima joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC that was used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory, she is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Maxima plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Bonanza (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Bonanza esta formado por un grupo de 9 mujeres quienes viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta es una ciudad de clima frió, tiene como atractivos sus 4 ríos que la bañan, su centro histórico, sus iglesias, su gastronomía  y su gente que es muy amable y cordial como nuestras socias, quienes son mujeres luchadoras que con su trabajo tratan de salir  adelante  y así brindarles un mejor futuro a sus familias.

La Señora María Elvira V. vive en la comunidad de Hiptocruz que pertenece a la parroquia de Turi, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo realizando los créditos en la fundación, fue invitada por su cuñada. Se dedica hace 25 años a la venta de quesillo (queso tierno) y granos, realiza sus ventas deambulando la ciudad,  también se dedica al negocio de ganado hace 26 años, labora lo días jueves de 6 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m.
La Señora María Elvira tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, dos de sus hijos son casados y viven de manera independiente, sus cuatro hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente y su ultimo hijo estudia  en el SECAP (Servicio Ecuatoriano de Capacitación Profesional), su esposo se dedica a realizar fletes en su camioneta y con el trabajo en conjunto han logrado tener su casa propia. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para incrementar su negocio. Su meta es poner un asador de carnes en su comunidad.

La Señora Bertha Soledad G. vive en la comunidad de  Hiptocruz que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi, tiene 23 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos de 3 años y 6 meses de edad, su esposo es panificador, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá de una manera independiente.
Doña Bertha Soledad se dedica al comercio hace 3 años, cuenta con un puesto propio en el mercado de la feria libre donde vende frutas, hortalizas y quesos.  Se encuentra en su primer crédito, fue invitada por su tía que es socia de la banca comunal, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de aguacates para vender en su puesto, su meta es  ponerse una panadería para que trabaje su esposo.
texts.en:
The Bonanza Communal Bank is comprised of nine women who live in different places in the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate. Its attractions are the four rivers that surround it, its historic center, its churches, its cuisine, and the warmth and friendliness of its people like our members. The women are strong-willed, and with their work they try to get ahead to give their families a better future. María Elvira V. lives in the Hiptocruz community which belongs to the Turi parrish. She is in her second loan cycle with the foundation. She was invited by her sister-in-law. She has been selling “quesillo” (soft cheese) and basic grains for 25 years. She makes her sales by roaming the city. She has also had a livestock business for 26 years. She works on Thursdays from 6 a.m. until 3 p.m. María Elvira is 48, married, and has seven children. Two of her children are married and live independently. Four of her children work and help her economically. Her last child goes to school at SECAP (Ecuadorian Service for Professional Training). Her husband makes deliveries in his truck. With both of them working they have managed to have their own house. The loan will be used to buy guinea pigs to increase her business. Her goal is to establish a business of roasting meat in her community. Bertha Soledad G. lives in the Hiptocruz community, which belongs to the Turi parrish. She is 23 years old, and she is in a common-law-marriage. She has two children; one is three years old, and one is six months old. Her husband is a baker. They do not have their own house, so they live in an independent way in her mother’s house. Bertha has been a businesswoman for three years. She has her own stand in the Feria Libre market. She sells fruit, vegetables, and cheese there. This is her first loan. She was invited by her aunt, who is a member of the communal bank. She will use the loan to buy avocadoes to sell at her stand. Her goal is to set up a bakery so that her husband can work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy guinea pigs and avocadoes

loans.name: Jessie's Group

texts.en:
Jessie V. is from the village of Boundary Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Jessie is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Tundan 2'.

Jessie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fruits like mango, durian, and rambutan in the local community. Jessie is just starting this business and earns 5000 PH a month.

In 2009, Jessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Jessie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Luz Y Progreso Group

texts.es: DORIS ES LA TESORERA DE LA ALCOM LUZ Y PROGRESO, QUIEN PARTICIPA DESDE HACE MAS DE DOS AÑOS, CON SUS SIETE INTEGRANTES MAS, EL GRUPO SE CARACTERIZA POR SER SOLIDARIO ENTRE ELLOS. NOS CUENTA QUE ELLA EMPEZÒ HACE TRES AÑOS A VENDER PEQUEÑOS PRODUCTOS COMO ARROZ, FIDEOS, LECHE EN UN ESPACIO DE SU CASA; AL PRINCIPIO LE COMPRABAN SOLO SUS FAMILIARES, DESPUES SUS VECINOS, POKO A POKO EMPEZO A MEJORAR SUS VENTAS Y FUE SURTIENDO EN EL TRANSCURSO DE LOS MESES, TAMBIEN SURGIO EL PROBLEMA DE BAJAR SUS INGRESOS DE VENTAS DEBIDO A QUE FIABA A  MUCHAS PERSONAS Y FUE POR ESO QUE SUS PRODUCTOS FUERON MENORANDO, SUS INGRESOS LE SIRVIERON PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR SU CASA, LE HACIA FALTA EL TANQUE DE AGUA DE SU CASA, QUE ES MUY ESCENCIAL PARA COCINAR, LIMPIEZA DE SU HOGAR, EN PARTE APOYA EN EDUCACION A SUS TRES NIÑOS, QUIENES ESTUDIAN AUN EN EL COLEGIO DE EDADES 05,14 Y 16 AÑOS, EL ULTIMO PRESTAMO QUE VA A RECIBIR ES PARA COMPRAR FIERROS, ARENA, LADRILLOS, PORQUE DESEA DARLES UN MEJOR AMBIENTE Y COMODIDAD A SUS HIJOS (CUARTOS).
texts.en:
Doris is the treasurer for the Alcom Luz y Progreso group, which she's been a member of for more than two years along with six other people. The group is known for being tight-knit. Doris tells us that three years ago she began selling small products like rice, noodles, and milk from a spot in her house. At first only her relatives bought from her, and then her neighbors did. Little by little she began to improve sales and over the months the business continued to develop, but the problem also arose of her income decreasing as she extended credit to a lot of people, which diminished her inventory. Doris used her income to complete construction on her house. She didn't have a water tank, which is essential for cooking and housecleaning. She also partially supports the education of her three children, aged five, fourteen, and sixteen, who go to school. She used her last loan to buy tools, sand, and bricks because she wanted to provide a better environment and give her children more comforts (rooms) at home.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools, sand, and bricks.

The coming heavy rainfall is good for growing; Sam R. is looking for assistance in order to help support her in the farm business. She and her husband are in the photo.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar is 37 years old and lives with his wife, father-in-law and two children, Shinebayar, 20, and Shinebileg, 18, both of whom are university students. Otgonbayar has been running his spare truck parts retail business for 10 years. He buys brand new new spare parts from wholesalers and sells them on the local market. He also sells secondhand parts, which he collects, fixes and replenishes. His business is doing very well because brand new spare parts for big trucks are very expensive. He has his own customers and his products are in good demand. He has taken out 3 loans from MFI already and has used them appropriately.

Otgonbayar has bought a piece of land and built a house on it. The family is very happy to have its own house now. Otgonbayar's father-in-law is 70 years old and is half-paralyzed, needing constant care. So Otgonbayar's wife takes care of her father. Otgonbayar is requesting this loan because he wants to increase his working capital and inventory. Also, higher education in Mongolia costs a quite a lot of money. Therefore he wants to pay for his two sons' annual university fees. One of his sons, Shinebayar, will graduate next summer.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and to pay his two sons' annual tuition fees

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith D. Peña is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by operating two businesses:  selling charcoal and fire wood and operating a passenger tricycle. She lives in Purok 5 B., Masaling, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. 

Since 1999, she has been a member of Kiva partner NWTF-Project Dungganon and she has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average income of PHP 15,000. 

Judith is borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can expand her charcoal and firewood business.  This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Judith aspires to elevate her family's living condition and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

Judith is shown in the picture with her tricycle which shuttles passengers around town and which she also uses to transport firewood and charcoal.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org in order to join our team.

loans.use: To expand a charcoal and firewood business.
